Reviews.Title: “Thank you for the hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Coaster1
Reviews.Content: This was a 2 night stop on our 1 week west coast trip that started in San Diego and ended in Seattle. Researched extensively ahead of time. The good reviews are true. Staff at check-in were superb and glad to help with bus information. Left our rental car in front of office for the entire stay. Walked about 4 or 5 blocks to take public buses into the tourist areas. No problem. Room was a little small, but clean and quiet. No problem. Nothing I would not expect in a urban area where space is a premium. Restaurant prices nearby were much more reasonable than the areas we took public transit to. The area around the Travelodge catered more to locals and their tastes and budget over the touristy areas closer to Fisherman's Wharf. An authentic San Francisco experience at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem in SFO”
Reviews.Author: AlvinAng
Reviews.Content: Lovely staff, very helpful in giving us local information and directions. Good value for money. Hotel located in a quiet location and neighbourhood didn't look too bad. Good access to buses and who could forget free parking as well. Once we arrived, we just left our car in the hotel and got around using the bus, armed with local knowledge from their friendly staff. The rooms are small in comparison with other places I have been in the USA. After travelling for a month in the USA, we managed to accumulate a fair bit of retail shopping, so we had quite a lot of bags. They were nice enough to remove the sofa chair to create more space for us. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting San Francisco. It's a lovely city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Travelodge”
Reviews.Author: Sandra F
Reviews.Content: From the minute we arrived we were greeted my the young lady at the front desk, Nikki who proceeded to accommodate our requests for multiple reservations for ourselves and additional family arriving the next day. Also making arrangements for us to move downstairs to the ground floor as soon as a room became available to accommodate my husbands need to not have to climb stairs after his knee replacement surgery. She was truly a joy and very competent and an easy person to interact with. Since our trip to SF was unexpected due to a family emergency we had to make arrangements very quickly and without notice. All the staff were genuinely friendly and very hospitable. Bruce was extremely polite, friendly and pleasant every time we interacted with him over our 4 day stay. When we would return to the hotel after our day out and about he would ask what we did that day and if we had a nice time. Thank you Bruce and Nikki you were exceptional! The entire staff for that matter were quite pleasant and very professional and went the extra step to make our stay more pleasant even carrying our heavy bags upstairs and down for us. We appreciate businesses and corporations in this day and age (of rudeness and no customer advocacy in general) that still pay attention to detail and care about providing great customer service. It truly made our stay that much better. Thank you for restoring our faith in a pleasant Travelodge experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff and right by the magnificent Presidio”
Reviews.Author: CDCPublicHealthDoc
Reviews.Content: Came here based on Tripadvisor review for one day in the city proper, and glad we did. Was lucky enough to get the last free parking spot ( a real benefit considering that downtown hotels wanted upwards of $30-$40/night ). Room was comfortable, with free Wi-Fi. Staff helped us to evaluate how we spent the next day before heading out of the city, and to decide on a walking tour of the excellent Presidio that is just down the street (Lombard Gate). The bathroom has just a shower, and there needed to be some repairs to dings in the bathroom wall, some cleaning up of blackened caulking, etc., but it was certainly good enough for our brief time there. The front desk staff and manager, Bruce, are this property's real assets. Everyone was both friendly, and helpful, and they allowed us to keep our luggage there a few extra hours. We didn't use the room safe, so that charge was removed from the bill, along with the room safe tax. Not sure what the corporate philosophy is as this is the first time in a lodging that there was a surcharge for a room safe. The free continental breakfast was simple fare, but sufficient - cold cereal, instant oatmeal, juices, coffee and muffins. Would certainly stay here again, particularly if visiting the Presidio area. Please advise if you find this review helpful. (www.fair.org fan)

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong SF Presidio”
Reviews.Author: DarcKloud
Reviews.Content: Presidio Travelodge in San Francisco, was a very pleasant surprise, This hotel was clean, comfortable, recently renovated and better than any travelodge I ever stayed, it was a great price for San Francisco, anything less you wouldn't want to stay. Now part of the Wyndham Group, I believe it's helped a little with this hotel. The manger, Bruce was very helpful and accommodating. He and Nikki took very good care of us and our other party who stayed 3 of the 4 nights in a second room. The 1st rm ( 2 QB ) was nice, comfortable beds but w/small bathroom. It was up stairs, and I needed a 1st floor, I'm Handicap ( walk w/cain ) and no lift. He moved us to the 1st floor to a small 1 kg bd, the bathroom even smaller, its a room not used normally but he had no vacancy on the 1st floor. Also it had free open parking, ( only 1 handicap space ). the continental breakfast was very simple, assortment of muffins. cereal, oatmeal, of course coffee, tea, juice and milk. It's location is fantastic right at the Presidio's Lombard gate, a lot to see in the Presidio, including the bridge, easy drive to gold gate park and most everything else you want to see and do. All-n-all I'd like it and will stay again next time we are in San Francisco. It's the staff that has me coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Friendly, Great Location, Safe”
Reviews.Author: Nikki L
Reviews.Content: Staff was very friendly and the location was awesome. The Presidio is right on your doorstep and great restaurants are about a half mile walk. The rooms were clean and the breakfast and afternoon snacks were a nice way to save money. We had a great time and would recommend to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely helpful staff made this average hotel a great stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Jonjesstravel
Reviews.Content: If you've stayed at a travel lodge, no surprises - clean, adequate sized rooms, adequate breakfast, good tv, etc... Where this hotel excels is its great service, helpfulness and friendly staff!! And the location is great, close to shops and restaurants of Chester street, on a bus stop, and 15 min walk to golden gate park!

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Just hope it stays this wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: KALKAT
Reviews.Content: i just stayed here for two nights over spring break. It exceeded all of my requirements of a hotel: clean, quiet, well-run, friendly, well-informed staff. I LOVED it, in other words. I especially liked Raymond, who gave me so much info; about San Francisco, about tours, restaurants, and even public transportation. My room was facing a patio/garden and was so clean, quiet and nice. i left very early one morning for a Yosemite tour and the girl who was there opened the door and offered me early continental breakfast--she didn't have to do that! I even loved the raccoon "on staff." I came out of my room one evening to get ice and ran into him on the balcony--we both did a double take and then he scurried up onto the roof. i can't wait to come back to this hotel. p.s. the pizza place two doors up closer to the Presidio entrance is really good! K. Lehman

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Inexpensive for SF”
Reviews.Author: runtom
Reviews.Content: It's located on a short quiet section of Lombard Street near the Presidio. The rest of Lombard is very noisy with 4 lanes of traffic. The Disney Family Museum is nearby as are Chestnut and Union Streets which offer shopping and restaurants. Raymond welcomed us enthusiastically and helped us plan our activities. Thanks to a sign in the lobby, we were able to visit the DeYoung Museum at no charge because of the "Free First Tuesday" policy. Free Wi-Fi speed was 1-2 Mbps. The continental breakfast was a little disappointing offering only croissants, packaged muffins, cereal, instant oatmeal, tangerines, coffee & tea. Parking is free, but the lot is small. We had difficulty exiting our parking space because management permitted someone to park in an area designated "No Parking." Our single King room was long and narrow. We had plenty of space on each side of the bed, but only about 16 inches between the foot of the bed and a dresser which contained the refrigerator. This meant we could only open the refrigerator door about half way. Our room was generally quiet, but people walking up and down stairs sounded like a herd of elephants. The bathroom fan was incredibly loud. Surely, quieter fans are available. Housekeeping staff was far too efficient. They threw away two unread newspapers we left on the dresser. Every other place we have stayed only empties the trash cans. They might rearrange magazines and newspapers left on furniture, but they do not dispose of them.

Reviews.Title: “Warm welcome, knowledgeable staff”
Reviews.Author: Love2Hike
Reviews.Content: We just stayed the last 2 nights here, my teenage son and I. This hotel is close to bus routes and within a 5 minute walk to the Presido and Science Museum. Many reviews have already been written about this hotel, and I can only reflect the good comments. From the moment we checked in we were welcomed with staff extremely knowledgeable about their own town, from how to get around on the Muni system to where the SF Guitar Center Store is and how do we get there. I would recommend this hotel for the knowledge of the staff alone, but the healthy breakfast and great nights sleep we had, albeit in the middle of a huge city, certainly only added to our wonderful stay. Thanks again to you all for being so wonderful!!!

Reviews.Title: “location and staff are great - rooms are dated”
Reviews.Author: rojo-amigo
Reviews.Content: Bruce, Nicky and Talyor are the staff that we dealt with and they supply good info for SF. The location is great. Only a couple blocks to catch the bus to major attractions. Only a block to 2 good restaurants and 5-6 for many eating places. Only a couple blocks to water and parks. The rooms are dated and could use paint and upgrades. It looks like the furniture is new. Breakfast is very limited. Cereal and muffins. Parking is very limited, but one should not have a car in SF anyways.

Reviews.Title: “Warm, friendly and good quality stay.”
Reviews.Author: Tmark9
Reviews.Content: The Travelodge at The Presidio is a unique accommodation. It is an historic hotel (has always been a Travelodge since being built in the 1940’s) and its 4 public faces (Taylor, Raymond, Bruce and Nikki) are courteous and welcoming. From the beginning of our communications with them, we were impressed by their readiness to help us in any way a hotel could. The accommodations are humble, clean, of good size (many hotels in SF have very small rooms) and offer what anyone would need to have a good sleep and be ready for a day in town. If you come to SF to look for a luxurious accommodation, look elsewhere and be ready to spend much more. This is intended to show respect to the establishment, as when we travel, we are going to there to experience the culture of the location, not wallow in luxury and spend all of our time in the room. If you are expecting a big breakfast with designer coffee, you’ll need to find a local establishment, several of which are only a few blocks away. We requested a dark room, which translates to a corner room that has no window to the front walkway/balcony. We could have asked for another room- possibly because of a slight feeling of claustrophobia, but we dismissed that almost as quickly as we thought of it. There is a circuit that will trip if you have the bathroom fan, three floor lamps and the television on when using a hairdryer, but we don’t “throw the baby out with the bathwater”- we mentioned it, they reset the breaker and we worked with it. Then we met Raymond. One would not expect the wealth of information that this Midwest transplant readily and enthusiastically offers. Almost anybody we encountered in SF was engaging, pleasant and ready to offer their TIME (unlike where we are from), but Raymond has this in abundance. As much as the other 3 had the aforementioned SF qualities, Raymond brings the “desireability” of this location to another level. In his few years living in SF, Raymond has gathered enough knowledge about how to get around town, where to go and what is available to you- according to YOUR desires and to any level of expense. The Travelodge’s location was optimal for accessing transit buses and a major road into SF. For those who want to leave their car at the hotel, Raymond showed us 4 bus routes that can get you to all major locations in the city. Once you get the hang of the buses and know what places to avoid (3 or 4 areas, more so at night), you can really find your traveling groove. Parking at the hotel may get competitive, but they will help you. Depending on your reason for going to SF, we recommend the Travelodge at the Presidio. If you research as much as we did and find something comparable, you are fortunate and even the staff at the Travelodge would be happy for you (!). If you’d rather not do a lot of researching, then decide on this place- you won’t be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Colin D
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights this past week and found myself very satisfied with my visit. Seeing as the hotel isn't as expensive as many in the area, I found myself with fairly low expectations. I was very pleasantly surprised to find a very nice, spacious hotel with a great mattress, TV and bathroom. The location couldn't be better. I walked all over the Marina and Presidio without even needing my car. I found the complaints about lack of parking space to be somewhat unfounded. Every night I managed to get a spot, even after returning as late as 11 PM two nights. There's a little bit of neighborhood noise at night from a bar around the corner and a preschool next door means children yelling at 8 in the morning, but those are minor complaints. Also, I found the neighborhood to be exceptionally safe, even late at night. That can always be somewhat of a concern when staying in a city. It's very residential around the hotel. It would have been nice to have a mini-fridge and an iron in the room. Another highlight of the stay was the very helpful and friendly staff. Bruce (I think) checked me in by name and was very welcoming when I arrived. The concierge, Raymond Archer, also was exceptionally knowledgable and helpful every morning. I'm fairly discerning about where I stay and while there are definitely cheaper options in the area, but I can confidently say in terms of "value" i.e. what you get for the price, this hotel can be considered a smart choice.

Reviews.Title: “rainny trip to San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: rmhtdl
Reviews.Content: Exellent value,location,cleanliness,up to date technology,and afriendly profesional crew.from housekeeping to the GM Tyler Shanahan;we had booked for 3 nights,but mother nature decided decided to(cry)relentlessly.I asked Tyler what the latest we could cancel the 3rd night to avoid penalty he gave me the answer immediatly and sugested a number of things to do on a stormy day.I will stay here again without a doubt .

Reviews.Title: “Great value, nice location and very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: MightyTree
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a 4 night stay in February. It was not overpriced so good value compared to most other hotels in San Francisco, but had everything we needed and more so an ideal choice. We asked for a larger room because we had a lot of luggage and got it. Lovely big comfy bed, large TV and decent size room. Shower was good. Has a in-room safe big enough for a laptop too, but at an extra charge of $1.50 a day. Breakfast was great to have thrown in and Wi-Fi was fast. The general manager, Tyler, was fantastic throughout our stay and made us feel more than welcome, giving us plenty of great advice on eateries, bus routes and places to go, so thank you Tyler! More than enough maps and things at the front desk too. Location is close to Golden Gate bridge and nice quiet residential part of town. About 5 mins walk to the bus stop to get the bus into town, which takes about 20 - 25 mins. Ok so you could stay somewhere nearer in town, but it'd be noisy, you'd pay a lot more and probably get less for your money - bus service is perfectly good if you don't have a car, which you don't really need in this city but would be useful if you're short on time. Definitely recommend and can't wait to come back to San Francisco, which is a fantastic city! A quick tip for the cable car - if you're going on the main Powell/Hyde route, it is usually very busy after about 1pm and you will be queuing for a while. Go in the morning when it's quieter.

Reviews.Title: “A place to visit again”
Reviews.Author: Shrimp2
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this motel was enhanced 100% by the manager Tyler that bent over backwards to make our stay as pleasant as possible. As well he gave great bus directions and restaurant suggestions and things to see and do. It was easy to get around by bus from here to see this great city. We would stay at this location again and have already recommended it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pet Motel”
Reviews.Author: tastydelight
Reviews.Content: My friend and I, along with my little dog, enjoyed the clean and comfy,large,quiet room with a two minute walk to the Presidio Gate, where little Katie could do her business. The staff, Bruce, Nikki and Oliver were very helpful with directions and advice about dining, etc. The price was very reasonable and little Katie got a large bag of doggy treats and my friend and I received a free coffee cup. How great is that?

Reviews.Title: “A great motel”
Reviews.Author: William I
Reviews.Content: We had read the reviews about this motel and decided to take a chance. We were well rewarded. The motel clerks were extemely courteous and helpful with directions and other needs. The room was hugh, clean and quiet. We would not hesitate to make this a choice in the future when visiting San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “My Mini Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Raquel D
Reviews.Content: My name is Raquel. I stayed at the Presidio with my Doberman Pinscher for two days, Tuesday, January 10, 2012 through Thursday, January 12, 2012. Overall, I was very pleased with my stay. Upon check- in Tyler also gave me a treat bag for my dog, with a few dog treats, that was really awesome!! I was greeted byTyler, Raymond and a few other members of the hotel numerous times. They were always very helpful, and knowledgeable of the area. Parking was not an issue, they were able to accommodate if necessary. Very close to nearby attractions, especially Fishermans Wharf, Golden Gate Bridge, Castro Street. I fell in love with San Francisco and the overall staff and hotel environment made it ten times better. I'd definately recommend this hotel and I'll be coming back in the near future!! The only thing I didn't care for was having to pay an extra $20 a night for my Dobie but I received a 20% off, mid week special, since I made my reservation online which helped. Thank you Presidio!

Reviews.Title: “Great option for free parking and pets”
Reviews.Author: FBFandCo
Reviews.Content: Reviews said the place was clean and staff was helpful, so we tried it. That was our experience--staff was friendly, parking was always there, and it's a great place to stay with a dog, since you can walk right over to the Presidio. If we had to bring a car to SF again, I'd stay be willing to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: Dave B
Reviews.Content: there was an employee here named Nicki that just went above and beyond for us. You could tell that she took great pride in doing the best job possible. If I was running a business this is exactly the kind of person I'd want working for me. Promote! Thank you Dave and Michele Bauer

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Trip&Location”
Reviews.Author: laneraft
Reviews.Content: This was the best choice we made for this trip. Raymond at the front desk made our trip so easy for us. He went out of his way to provide tips and advice on how to get around and where to go. Great location and great staff! Will always stay here when in SF.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel in a Great City”
Reviews.Author: RogerRamjett
Reviews.Content: We made our annual foray to the City and there is no place we would rather stay... 20 years and counting. Nikki's friendly check in, Bruce's warm morning welcome and Ray's kind answers to our many questions... it was like seeing old friends. Tyler the Mgr makes it all hum smoothly, These people seem as if they like what they are doing, and each other. The newly-remolded rooms, flat screen TVs and the quintessential location; walking distance to the Bridge, Walt Disney Museum inside the gorgeous Presidio.... make this is the best point of departure for North Beach, GG Park, and Napa... The rooms are clean, have a fridge, are very quiet for being on Lombard and plenty of parking (Hey it's SF) Thank you again for a wonderful time in a great city....

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Terrific Staff”
Reviews.Author: cyndie m
Reviews.Content: We stayed on two occasions in the fall of 2011. It was a great experience for us as it was quiet and we felt safe. Although parking is limited we always got a spot. What is really outstanding is the customer sevice. The staff was friendly and very helpful, especially Nicky. Our thanks goes to Nicky for handling our reservation and making sure we were comfortable during our stay. Also, she is able to answer any questions you have and so nice just to talk to. We will always stay at the Presidio Travelodge when we are in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, good service, adequate room - A Bargain!”
Reviews.Author: Marvey42
Reviews.Content: Finding a safe, quiet, reasonably priced hotel in a walkable location for four older women on a Museum Tour was a challenge. This Travelodge was perfect. They were able to give us two rooms with two beds (not easy to find) and on-site free parking. (Arrive early as the lot fills quickly). The bathroom showed its age but then so do we. All was clean and comfortable. The staff helped us find our way around the neighborhood, a great walking district (Chestnut St.) and we loved our stay. Convenient to the Legion of Honor and the De Young Museum without have to hassle Downtown. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Raymond!!!”
Reviews.Author: susforzu
Reviews.Content: We spent a few days in August 2011. The location is great and it's easy to reach the highlights of San Francisco by bus or car. The room was extremely comfortable and internet was free. The staff is terrific, especially Raymond who has been very nice and helpful to us. We really enjoyed our staying!

Reviews.Title: “amazing customer service”
Reviews.Author: glenn k
Reviews.Content: can't say enough positive things about the front desk staff. raymond gave us a long list of great restaurants, sites and directions to get to candlestick park. the hotel is in a great neighborhood and everything is in walking distance. raymond also saved us a small fortune, when he recommended the american airporter shuttle service. staying in the presidio area, the hotel is a very strong value. if we return to san francisco, we will stay at this location again.

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: uclabruin19
Reviews.Content: After reading all the great reviews, I expected something entirely different. The towels looked extremely dirty in the restroom, we hesitated showering and used as little towel as possible. I woke up throughout the night, wondering if there were animals scurrying throughout my room. We parked down the street as the parking was full, not a problem for us, but others might find this annoying. In the morning, we wanted to grab some coffee, but one look at their kitchen and we decided to buy coffee. The kitchen looked filthy, the door should have been closed. The staff was very nice and friendly, but I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Better than most of the other comperable hotels in its area.”
Reviews.Author: JFJman
Reviews.Content: Good rates, good location, clean, friendly service, free decent continental breakfast. Unfortunately I wasn't able to stay at this hotel on my last visit to San Francisco because I booked my trip on Hotels.com and got stuck in a dingy hotel down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, good price for SF, unbelievable staff!”
Reviews.Author: ATWD
Reviews.Content: We had a nice 3 night stay in early October during Fleet week. We had no idea when we were planning our trip that we would find such expensive prices all over SF. The Presidio Travelodge had the best price we were able to locate, but we had read good reviews so we decided to give it a try. The breakfast was minimal but worked just fine for our family. The staff constantly were stocking the breakfast and making sure everyone had what they needed. There is a nice pizza place right around the corner, that serves breakfast, lunch and dinner. The Presidio is right up the street and we wished we had longer to explore there. The staff was amazing. They were always helpful, and friendly. We were able to print our Alcatraz tickets in the business center. I had noticed the reviews about Raymond's customer service. We only got to see him on the day we departed, but he was an amazing SF tour guide! He was able to share with us SF history and offer some suggestions on unique spots to watch the Fleet Week Parade before we had to head to the airport. Coming from the Southeastern US we found California to be crazy expensive!! The Presidio Travelodge was a good bargain! Great Customer Service wins everytime!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: Wingtravel_10
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is right at the main gate of the Presidio on Lombard Street. Although the rooms are not huge, they are spotless. Cleaning service is excellent and considerate if you want to sleep in. The front desk people couldn't be nicer and if you need local information, they have it. Great little deli/sandwich shop and pizza place right next door if you get hungry. Honestly I have been in top name hotels which didn't offer half the cleanliness or helpfulness of this treasure. If there's one downside, it's parking. Like most places in SF, the free parking lot is small and you could end up parking on the street if you get there late. That said, there is every bus imaginable right at the corner and the desk staff will be glad to provide maps and directions to any destination you might care to visit. Personally when I return to SF, I'll be staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, knowledgable, and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Brs5tettba
Reviews.Content: Nice room, wifi was easy to set up. Taxis drive nearby, some nice restaurants within walking distance. $15 cab to/from BART.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable hotel with great staff - free parking”
Reviews.Author: Bebbi77
Reviews.Content: We arrived late morning and the room was already done. We could deposit our luggage and park the car without any problem. The staff was extremly friendly and helpful - one could see that they love what they do. The other plus is the free parking. The hotel is easy accesible if you arrive from north taking the golden gate bridge.

Reviews.Title: “Raymond is great”
Reviews.Author: zach B
Reviews.Content: if your are staying at this hotel hopefully you will arrive on a day that Raymond is working. He is a very kind and cheerful employee which helped us out so much when we were there, he highlighted bus routes for us on maps helped us with bags, can name over 50 restaurants to eat at. He even helped us check into a flight back home. Just want to thank him

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Choice!”
Reviews.Author: ColinandJane
Reviews.Content: We arrived later than planed due to a nightmare drive through SF due to getting lost just after coming over the Golden Gate Bridge. Tired and slightly testy we were warmly welcomed by Bruce who carried both suitcases to the third floor at the same time! He also advised us to go to Liverpool Lil's for our evenings food and drink which is literally just around the corner which was very good - see separate review. The room was excellent and the bed was great. Breakfast was juice, coffee, tea, cereal, apples & muffins in the hospitality room which had a huge map for you to pin your home town into. Also around the corner is the local bus stop which made it easy to get into town and back. If you're lucky you may get a lady bus driver who sings and gives out lollypops to good passengers! Lombard Street carries on past the hotel and into the Presidio and this is a great place for a early morning walk. It's only about a mile to the cemetery just past the Main Post - it took us about an hour walking slowly and taking photo's to get their and the view of the Golden Gate Bridge is great, it's also interesting to have a little walk in the cemetery itself. Also worth a visit is the Pizzeria Avelino next door. Finally down Lyon St (turn right at the top of Lombard) and across the road is the San Francisco Palace of Fine Arts - also worth a walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: avalon20013
Reviews.Content: Me and my sister stayed here for a few days this past october. Room was a bit snug, but was nice. Location was great. Best part is the staff. Everyone was friendly and super helpful, tons of good suggestions for meals and tips for getting around.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: MichaelaChris
Reviews.Content: This is in a good location, a short walk away from the main buses and excellent places to eat. The room was clean and quiet with everything you need including a safe. The star of the stay has to be Raymond at the front desk (who I notice has been mentioned in other reviews!). He was very welcoming and incredibly helpful giving us valuable information and recommendations for the area. He spent a good 10-15 minutes with us showing us a map drawing up the bus and cable car routes and recommending places to eat. We went to a few of these places to eat and we weren't let down! I hope it doesn't get him in trouble but he even allowed us the use of some cling film from the kitchen to wrap our sandwiches for the next day! He's definitely an asset to the company! There's free parking although the spaces are limited. The one downside would be the breakfast, there are criossants if you get there early enough but no butter or jam to go with them and limited cereals. All in all we enjoyed our stay here and would definitely stay here again next time we're in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Looks can be Deceiving”
Reviews.Author: Radarz
Reviews.Content: After some of the hotels we have stayed in the first impressions of this hotel could put you off. Well don't be deceived. We arrived here in the dark and on first look the place looked a bit run down and shabby. The light of day the next day allowed us to see where we were and re-assess our opinion. As others have mentioned here this hotel is situated in a quiet area of San Francisco at the end of Lombard Street. Our cabbie did have a little trouble finding it, but he did not realise that Lombard Street actually goes straight ahead and the road that bears to the right is actually Richardson Street and leads to the Golden Gate Bridge. Once that was sorted out all was OK. The staff were very friendly and helpful on arrival and nothing changed in the 3 nights we stayed. The breakfast is basic, but what is there is very good. Public transport to down town is 5-10 Mins walk away (Bus 30) and less than 5 mins to the bus that will take you to the Golden Gate Bridge Park (Bus 28). The cost of public transport is $2.00 each for 2 Hrs so very cost effective. We went to walk the Golden Gate and were back in time before our tickets ran out so the whole excursion cost $4.00US. Liverpool Lils which is around the corner from the Hotel is a place that once again on first impressions I would not visit. But based on the recommendations from this site we gave it a go. It was fantastic. I have never been asked how I want my hamburger cooked before and it was excellent. My wife had the 1/2 chicken and it was just as good. The parking is free, but limited in space and if there are no spots, you must park in the street. We have been told it is quite safe to do so. If I had a complaint it would be that the hotel only supplies enough coffee supplies for one cup. A bit odd if there are two people in the room. The room was always kept clean and the service could not be faulted.

Reviews.Title: “Very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Rosalien58
Reviews.Content: We visit several travelodge motels during our stay in the US last summer. But this was one of the motel which was a little disappointing. Our room was extremely small. If you enter the room, you almost walk against the bed. If you place a suitcase, there is hardly any room left to manouvre. When you enter the bathroom, you have to walk in completely to close the door. I booked this motel due to the very good reviews on tripadvisor. But as said I was disappointed especially for the amount of money $135. The two guys at the desk are extremely friendly and helpfull. We had the bad luck that there was a group with motorcycles who left in the middle of nights (two nights) which was extremely loud. You can easily take a bus to the center, just 1,5 block away. Take you to the wharf in about 10-15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: dorinne7
Reviews.Content: Our 5 day stay at the Travelodge at the Presidio was wonderful. Great place for the money ... a real good deal. Staff was helpful in helping us find buses and things to do in San Fran. The parking lot fills up fast so get there early. The beds were super comfortable and the Wi-Fi hookup worked great too. The location is close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet room, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: nur e
Reviews.Content: Quiet neighborhood. Extremely helpful staff. Clean room. The city was foggy during our stay. Raymond helped us figure out when's the best time to see the Golden Gate Bridge by logging on to a live webcam on his computer. He is just amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome staff and location”
Reviews.Author: TorontoBarb
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights at the end of September. You can't beat the location - it's in a quiet neighbourhood and really close to buses that will take you everywhere you will need to go. I never had to wait for more than 5 minutes for a bus. There are lots of restaurants nearby. Liverpool Lil's is great. And there is a deli/store and a pizza place next door - which is super convenient (especially when you are tired after a day of walking around and just want to grab a slice and some wine and relax). Bruce and Raymond are AWESOME! They are super helpful, friendly and really helped to make my stay great. If for no other reason, this is a reason to stay. Just a 'warning': if you want a 5 star hotel, this isn't your place. It is clean and functional - and really, what else do you want in a hotel room. The room is on the small side, and so is the bathroom (my room had a shower and no tub). There is a fridge (which is convenient) and a single cup coffee maker in the room. Another upside, there is breakfast served in the common room. There is cereal, muffins, oatmeal - and most importantly, coffee. :) There are no elevators. My room was on the 3rd floor - and after walking all day...well, the stairs were not a welcome sight. But it wasn't the end of the world. When planning my trip, I was trying to figure out whether to stay near Fisherman's Wharf or Union Square. I am so glad I picked this place. I got to see things that I wouldn't have by staying in one of the other 'touristy' locations. The hotel is right across from the Presidio and is a 15 minute walk to Crissy Field where you can sit on the beach and look at the Golden Gate. And it's a 5 minute walk from a Starbuck's and the Yoda Statue - so if you are geeky like me, you can have a latte and hang with Yoda.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Jesse J
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights, sept. 21-22. We were very pleased with the location. Save neighborhood also for walkin after dark. The motel itself had a small room, don't forget it is a Travelodge. But it has a good overal feel. In a lot of other city's you would pay a whole lot less for a room like this, that is the result of being in a city like SF. Afcourse we tried to spend as little time as possible in our room....Your in San Francisco!! Free parking is a big plus in this city. We did not touch the car in 2 days. Breakfast was typical motelmuffins, you know what I mean and (for us) below adverage. So we left that for what is was and ate breakfast elswere. What made our stay the best is concierge Raymond. He is so passionate about his city! He is willing to explain every detail to you. Took a map and drew out al the different bus and cable care lines, with different colored markers. Dotted in the numbers of the buses. That was great and very convenient. We did not have to worry if we were going in the right direction. And thus able to see and do everything we wanted. Raymond gave such great tips on what not to miss, after listening to our preferences! Also on dining options. He told us he tried more that 350 restaurants. There is a street within walking distance called Chestnut, and there are a ton of good restaurants and coffeeplace (like a Starbucks). We liked that street and the atmosphere a lot. Eat at a very good Italian rest. called Parma. Nice to be by foot so you can drink a glass of wine! Would definitly stay again and Raymond (and the very nice weather, blue skies and warm!!!) made our stay extra special

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: DinahLee
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the travelodge in August, and recommend it. The location is excellent. It is in a quiet neighborhood across from the Presidio-which a beautiful place to stroll through. It is close to bus lines, and walking distance to Union Street. Liverpool Lil's is a fun restaurant located around the corner. It does have free parking spaces for about a dozen cars. The room is small, but just fine. The hotel offers free breakfast and use of their business center to print boarding passes. What the hotel really has to offer, though, is the most helpful, friendly staff you would want to meet. Both Bruce and Raymond were helpful in giving us bus line info, general tourist information and arranged for a shuttle service to pick us up to go to the airport. They also stored our luggage for us after we checked out.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice, Clean, & Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Tampa3
Reviews.Content: The room was on the small side but very nice and quite. The bed was comfortable and everything was very clean. Easy to get to Fisherman's Wharf by cab or car. We found parking near the wharf for $20 a day. Parking is free at the motel and even though spaces are limited we didn't have a problem. Raymond greeted us on our arrival and showed us where to park. Free continental breakfast was standard and fine for us, but if you want a regular breakfast there is a restaurant near by. We went to Liverpool Lil's right around the corner for dinner the first night we got there and it was excellent. What really makes this motel outstanding though are the people who work there. They are all so friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Well located with free parking”
Reviews.Author: Jane_Paul_Adelaide
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located on Lombard St, near the Presidio. It cost $15 to get a taxi to Fisherman's Wharf as we left our own car at the hotel. Parking is very expensive around the area, so that worked out okay. The room was clean but around the 3 star standard but we weren't in it much so it didn't worry us. HBO and Wifi is free and a light breakfast of cereal was provided. Bruce and the staff at the Travelodge were excellent and we thank them for our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Toothpick72
Reviews.Content: The accommodation is a little small. We are traveling with two children (9 & 11) and with 4 pieces of luggage there was not too much room. Having said that, that was the only downfall of the place. The beds were comfortable and the staff were like family. The moment we check in they were nothing but helpful. Raymond Archer runs a great ship and was a wealth of knowledge on what tours to take and where to eat. Bruce was very helpful too. The hotel has limited free parking, however you can park on the street for free. The wifi is good and the breakfast was basic but nice, coffee, juice, cereal, muffins and fruit. The location is right next to the Presidio entrance and a short walk to some great restaurants and boutique shops on Chestnut Street, defiantly try Mamacita (Mexican) restaurant, it's jumping with great food as well as catering for kids.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: AllysonPeterson
Reviews.Content: For an average for $112 per night this motel was great. Unlike the other motels, inns, and motor lodges located on/adjacent to Lumbard this place was very clean and quite, and it literally 50' from the Presidio entrance. I would feel good having kids here too. This is NOT a down down hotel, but for what it is, it was great. The whole staff was friendly and everyone know the bus system and the best times/ways to get where you wanted to go. Raymond was especially helpful with all the directions we needed. The buses all picked up within a few blocks and their was great food very close. If you are into shopping I highly recommend Chestnut St and Union St - both very close. My favorite restaurant in the area is Parma. Our room was the king over the office, and again, quite. We had a fridge and a parking spot at no extra change, which other places on Lumbard were charging money to use. There was also a simple continental breakfast (cereal, backed goods, fruit, juice, and coffee) in a nice sitting area that was open until 10pm at night. We called last minute to add an extra night onto our reservation after getting burnt out from camping at Yosemite. Raymond booked us and even said he could honor the discounted rate I got from booking so early even though now it was a same day booking. If your trying to be budget savy and a going to SF to see the city, this is a great place to stay. Thanks to the whole staff for making out stay great!

Reviews.Title: “not great”
Reviews.Author: tracey b
Reviews.Content: Basic accommodation for the price, i believe that the tourist tax on accommodation in San Fran is high so prices are elevated (ie, you get less for your money) the room was ok, a litle aged looking, the bolster cushions i immediatley removed from the beds - grubby! The staff we met were great, very informative and friendly. The breakfast was basic. Car parking available, andspace on the street if needed.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: God's chosen county of Lancashire - England
Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: Dominico76
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for five nights (five for the price of four) of a 39 night road trip. Nice hotel in a safe neighbourhood. Conveniently located for Presidio Park, buses into the city centre, cafes and restaurants. Parking is limited, but as my car didn't move for the duration of my stay it wasn't a problem! My room was on the top floor and was quiet, clean & comfortable. The staff were extremely pleasant and helpful on the occasions I spoke to them, offering lots of advice on where to go (and how to get there), what to see, etc. Breakfast was the usual cereal & toast - did the job. Would I stay here again? Yes...

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Trip”
Reviews.Author: surness
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here five times in the past four years and it is always the same! This time it was our honeymoon. This is an old, updated, and well kept motel next to the Presidio in the Marina district, very near Crissy field (and the Sports Basement), and a couple of blocks off Chestnut. The staff is always friendly and helpful, and the rooms are always quiet and clean. Both parking and the internet are free. Around one corner is the Baker St. Bistro and the other direction is Liverpool Lils, and they both offer great food. The Chestnut Bakery and Marina Market are also close by. Public transportation is great. It is a nice walk to GG Park, to the ferries, and the Embarcadero. What more could you want.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice front desk, clean, comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: KarenKAFVL
Reviews.Content: My husband was in the hospital and needed a last minute place to stay. I was pretty tired and stressed because he was in ICU and the front desk was very nice and accommodating. This hotel was quite a nice surprise. We've stayed at the Country Hearth Inn next door and was not all that pleased. I thought this place would be similar but not so! Very nice and comfortable bed, clean room, nice size refrigerator, parking! Was out in the morning before the cont breakfast so can't comment on that. Will definitely stay here when we come to SF for other than a hospital visit!

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money in a quiet location”
Reviews.Author: larix3338
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights in this hotel and got the 5th night free. The hotel is located in a quiet and residential area near the Presidio so we had to take the bus to go downtown, but it was an good way to discover the city. A few restaurants and a pleasant pub nearby. Room a bit small for 4 people but very clean. Breakfast included and good services (locker in the room, free wifi...). The staff was very friendly and helpful. We recommend this hotel to people who don't want or need to stay downtown.

Reviews.Title: “It was a great place for our purposes”
Reviews.Author: Tamir S
Reviews.Content: We were on a family trip. We took 2 rooms (2 adults and 3 childern). For the kids we received a large room which was convenient. Location is quiet, off the noisy part of Lombard St. Also, near buses going to all parts of the city. Price s reasonable. The best thing was one of the managers called Raymond. He knows SF like the palm of his hand. He helped us in great detail in what to do and where and how to go during our 4 day stay in SF. He drew all the bus routes for us on the map, explained where to get down and what to see, recommended good restaurants in the area and much more. As foreigners, it was great help for us. We thank him dearly. They were also very helpful with the luggage and other small things.

Reviews.Title: “Bruce at the front desk was awesome!”
Reviews.Author: heartifacts
Reviews.Content: This was a great pet friendly motel! Very comfortable and the service we received from Bruce at the front desk was fantastic! He helped us with the public transit and gave us great directions getting out of San Fran to enjoy the Scenic Pacific Coast Highway! We will choose this motel again!

Reviews.Title: “good location & decent accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Saskadon
Reviews.Content: Reasonably priced for being right in San Francisco. If you enjoy walking, it is right outside the Presidio and a walkable distance from Fisherman's Wharf. The room was clean and comfortable, and more spacious that we expected for being right in the city. Breakfast selection is limited but adequate. Staff is extremely friendly and helpful! Only problem was with the quirky a/c & heater, but with some help from the staff it did the job eventually. Parking is available but limited.

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: pjmac123
Reviews.Content: The Travelodge was not cheap, but then nothing is in San Francisco, so when compare to other hotels in the area it's actually quite a good deal. The room is basic, but had all the facilities we needed including a safe, fridge, hair dryer, TV, Air Con, etc. Staff were friendly and keen to help by providing as much information as they could (some times too much!). Breakfast was ideal - juice, coffee, cereal and pastries, enough to get your day off to a good start. Location is isn't perfect, but you'll pay a hefty premium to be any closer to the centre of the city. The walk from the hotel to Fisherman's Wharf is probably about 45 minutes, but we did it a few times and coped fine. There's so much to see and do in San Fran it's great! We hired a car and the location from that perspective was ideal. Close to the golden gate bridge and the Travelodge provides free parking which we managed to get a space in every time. All in all, we were satisfied with our stay here and would definitely recommend San Fran to anyone thinking of going! :)

Reviews.Title: “Right at the gates of the Presidio!”
Reviews.Author: pepperanella
Reviews.Content: Stayed here based on other TripAdvisor recommendations and we were not disappointed. Simple, clean (and safe) accomodations with free parking, outgoing, happy staff that were very informative about the area and how to get around by foot or bus. You can walk to the Yoda statue at ILM in 5 minutes :) ...great fun for the kids! We requested a room in the back which was very quiet. Breakfast is minimal; plan on an early lunch. Price was great in relation to typical SF prices...allowed us to splurge on other things during the trip! Super easy to access as you head up/down HWY 101 just below the Golden Gate bridge. We'll be back next time we're traveling through.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: Oxypete
Reviews.Content: Very nice place that I am sure we will stay at again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful welcome”
Reviews.Author: BBBBracknell
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights after a flight from the UK, staff were very friendly, especially Raymond who went out of his way to show us the best bus routes around SF. Very quiet area, got a great sleep in a great location for public transport. Parking was easy and breakfast was just what we needed. Will definitely stay here again next time. Great pizza place next door. Raymond even let us take away a mug, nice little souvenir !

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: Serendipitynme
Reviews.Content: When planning our trip we changed our hotel based on what we read on this site and we are very glad we did. This trip could have been a disaster but we have only GOOD things to say about our visit. Found free parking on site when we arrived and that alone made our stay more affordable. Friendly staff showed us how to get around on public transportation and the location was an excellent choice for everything we wanted to do. Used the city bus system for transportation and found it easy to get around. Our room was quiet, clean and comfortable. I have allergies and was concerned that pets were allowed but experienced no allergy issues. Continental breakfast but no restaurant on site. Didn't matter for us because we were out and about all day. Front desk had good suggestions...we were clue-less! We asked for Dim Sum suggestions and received a list. We chose one because they were the highest rated and when we arrived there was a line over a block long waiting to get in. We went elsewhere because our time was limited but I can only imagine how heavenly their food must have been! Have been telling friends about this trip and recommending Travelodge at the Presidio!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: BirgitCollegePark_MD
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good choice if you like to spend a few days in San Francisco. We found the staff exceptionally kind and helpful. Bruce gave us great tourism advice, directions and tips concerning transportation--which he could pass on first-hand as he had gone through the trouble of trying things first. The room was just big enough to accommodate our family of four and had comfortable beds. We loved the location--next to the Presidio, a lovely park area, walking distance to the Exploratorium, a kid museum, and just 2 blocks from a sight-seeing bus stop.

Reviews.Title: “Felt Like Staying With Friends/Family”
Reviews.Author: stephnewyork32
Reviews.Content: I LOVE this hotel. It's in the perfect spot, has free parking-limited, but there is plenty of safe street parking in the area-Raymond greeted me like an old friend and was really helpful getting me and my small dog settled the day we arrived. He went out of his way to make us feel welcomed and even recommended a few places to grab dinner and gave us extra towels for my dog since it was stormy. Bruce was also awesome and was the one who helped me with my reservations. I highly recommend this hotel, and will be staying here again next time I am in SF.

Reviews.Title: “Great value coupled with incredible staff.”
Reviews.Author: pettyr
Reviews.Content: I came to know of this hotel via some SF locals recommendations. I can't thank then enough as not only was the Travelodge a great deal, they made my time in SF much more interesting thanks to their incredible knowledge of the city. Even if you stay elsewhere, come to the front deal here if you need help with the city. The hotel was also very well maintained and is in a great location. The local bus stops make getting around a breeze as well. Will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: SubarcticHomebody
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Travelodge after reading the reviews here on TripAdvisor. My husband, five year old son and I stayed here at the tail end of a four day car trip. We are relatively familiar with the area and were only planning a single day of sightseeing in SF. We had a car with us. The Travelodge provided the perfect location. After a long day of driving we were able to cross the Golden Gate Bridge and check in shortly after 3 pm without having to slog through rush hour traffic. We appreciated being able to park for free off the road and in sight of our room. We had a room on the third floor with two queen sized beds. With tax, our cost was about ~$150. We felt this to be an extremely good value. The room was small, but clean and well appointed. There was a desk, arm chair, small refrigerator, vanity, and TV all squeezed into the space with our beds. The bathroom counter and cabinets, light fixture, and mirror all appeared to be relatively new. Our refrigerator door was broken and missing the lower rack, but this did not interfere with our use of it. We neglected to report this to the management. The heating/cooling system for the room was oddly complicated for me. I'm sure the front desk would have been happy to help had we requested it. We also didn't contact them about this. Considering we aren't used to sleeping in an urban area, we were amazed at how quiet our room was. We left the bathroom window open and could hear fog horns in the distance, but that was about it. The hotel is immediately across the street from the Presidio which has lovely walking paths. We enjoyed walking to the Exploratorium at the Palace of Fine Arts. We also enjoyed walking to the Wave Organ. George Lucas' studios are also within walking distance, as are many restaurant choices. As mentioned by other reviewers, Raymond was tremendously helpful and friendly. He was able to suggest activities that might interest our five year old and restaurants that were child friendly and not too far away. He obviously loves his job and takes it very seriously to make sure that each guest has the information needed to enjoy their stay to the fullest. The continental breakfast was drinks, Svenhards packaged danishes and cold cereal. This hotel worked out perfectly for our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, free parking a plus, excellent location and the staff is enthusiastic and helpful!”
Reviews.Author: Mbeam1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for four nights and enjoyed our stay immensely! The staff went out of their way to make sure that we were happy and comfortable! Bruce and Nikki had some excellent suggestions about things to do in the city! It is a great value and location! We would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “june 2011 stay”
Reviews.Author: jcesar
Reviews.Content: this is an average hotel in most respects, but one employee in particular allows it to rise above others in this price range as well as those higher priced. Raymond without prompting shared with us his knowledge of the city and did so with such enthusiasm that i felt i need to leave a review on this site. we had never been to San Fran, and were just going to play each day "by ear". Raymond ensured we knew which bus lines to take & where to catch them, what sites to see, what restaurants to hit, how to do all this cost effectively, and SO much more! it was as if we had our own tour guide. the location is great. the rooms and hotel is clean, but Raymond made the stay and the trip! thanks, Raymond!

Reviews.Title: “Finest place in SF”
Reviews.Author: daviderebellin
Reviews.Content: perfect place to stay and visit SF, near to good restaurants and public transport! Rooms are clean and perfect and breakfast okay! A very friendly and helpfull staff : If you have questions about attractions, transport, tours, etc. ask the staff!! they know everything!! We had a wonderful stay at Travelodge Presidio! thx David

Reviews.Title: “HUGE Thanks to Raymond and the Rest of the Staff”
Reviews.Author: rachel_reed
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on TripAdvisor reviews and are glad we did! The rooms are clean, modern, and comfortable, and the hotel is a perfect base from which to explore San Francisco! My dad and I were in town for a couple of days as SF was one of our stops on a two week roadtrip up the coast, and I definitely think we spent our time there effectively thanks to suggestions and tips from Raymond and Nicole. Their knowledge of the city, from the best Thai restaurants to the musuems with the best photography exhibits, was above and beyond that of any travel agent I have dealt with. Raymond, especially, can recommend any type of cuisine you choose and give you the low down on what seems to be every restaurant in San Fran! They were always waiting at the desk with a smile to answer any questions you might have. Definitely recommend Travelodge at the Presidio to anyone visiting San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Everybody loves Raymond”
Reviews.Author: WaipahuTraveler
Reviews.Content: The Travelodge at the Presidio is a small homey motel off the beaten path. It is very conveniently located near to bus stops that can take you anywhere in San Francisco. There are a lot of really good neighborhood restaurants and shops just one street away. The rooms are nice sized, furnished with nice furniture and comfortable beds, and very clean. Parking can be a bit tight, but we found parking every night. The room rates are very reasonable and there is a continental breakfast with very good coffee. This is not a resort, but if you are looking of a nice, clean, comfortable place to sleep at night after an exhausting day of sight-seeing, I cannot think of a better place. Now, here is the best part. The front desk person, RAYMOND, is absolutely the best front desk guy I have ever met. He is better than the concierges I have met at 5-star hotels while on conferences. He is just a wealth of information and he makes you feel like you are the only guest in the motel. He provides you with great strategies on seeing the city. He helps you organize your sight seeing so you can get the most out of San Francisco. He knows practically all of the restaurants in the city. And--Raymond is just a truly nice guy if you just want to talk stories for awhile. Our family loved Raymond and he was a big part of our wonderful experience at the Presidio Travelodge. Aloha from the Waipahu Traveler

Reviews.Title: “reviews were true”
Reviews.Author: Sue and E
Reviews.Content: Its age shows but is decent & quiet at night. Rm 201 probably the worst location on street but not a problem as we are early risers. Raymond was FANTASTIC. 3 other staff members were also top notch

Reviews.Title: “I´ve enjoyed my stay very much”
Reviews.Author: Dirk-van-Elsingen
Reviews.Content: Since my English isn´t very well,I really appreciate the useful instructions from Raymond (Who was mostly the morning desk during my stay). I feel bad as I haven´t had the chance to say thank you and goodbye to him.....Kudos to Raymond! But everyone does a good job....thank you all!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: berock
Reviews.Content: • Staff VERY helpful - didn't mind answering lots of questions. Advised us on eating places, tours to take, traffic, etc. Raymond was especially helpful in answering our questions. • Parking is free, but is a very small lot. Staff helps get you parked. They even allowed us to leave the car there for the day after we checked out, which was great because parking is difficult in San Francisco! • Room was very small & crowded, & bathroom miniscule, but clean & adequate. • Bus stop is about 3 blocks from the hotel. • Breakfast limited but enough to get you started for the day.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great value!”
Reviews.Author: meganrachael
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my parents in May for a few days. It was our first time in San Francisco and the staff were extremely helpful in giving tips and advice. Raymond in particular made a great impression on us - he even helped us with a rental car problem. The beds were comfortable and the free breakfast was pretty good. The place is kind of tired looking but it's clean and comfortable. The walls are a little bit thin but I had no trouble sleeping. It was a great base for sightseeing, there is a bus stop just around the corner and it's fairly near the Golden Gate Bridge. I would definately stay here again, and would also recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly Great Place and Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Darby8
Reviews.Content: The friendly staff knows S. F. well and will help in every way possible. Free parking! Comfie beds, squeaky clean room, the location is an oasis of quiet right next to the Presideo. A morning or sunset walk on the grounds is beautiful. Simple breakfast available to get your day started. I'll be back and you should try this "aiming to be #1" hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Super friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: NorthCountryFemme
Reviews.Content: The room is large and the beds are good. If you're in San Francisco chances are like us you won't spend a lot of time in your room so it's a good, economical option, given the free parking and WIFI. Some places may look cheaper but when you factor in parking costs it's a different story. It's close to everything. We parked our car and walked or use used public transportation everywhere. Two downsides: the bathroom fan is deafening and it's wired into the lighting. You can't have the light on in the bathroom without almost damaging your hearing. Strength of the WIFI is patchy. Sometimes it was slow. Other times it just dropped out.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: penguin22358
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying here May 12-16. I can't say enough good things about our stay. The room (one king bed) was roomy, easily handling 4 pieces of luggage, a backpack and a small cooler with plenty of space to spare. The bed was extra comfy, complete with down blanket and plenty of extra pillows. The room decor was very nice and update, complete with a flat screen TV (not that you watch that much TV while in San Francisco). The room was extremely clean, in fact, immaculate. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful, especially Nicolette and Raymond, who are experts at helping with public transportation planning (they actually use the public transportation so they really do know the system and routes). Raymond helped us plan out a route, on the day of the Bay to Breakers race, that would get us to California Academy of Sciences. Nicolette was great at showing us the routes to downtown at rush hour. A bonus is that you can buy transit passes right at the hotel, I believe the only hotel in the city who offers all the transit pass options. We used public transportation for our entire stay and never encountered any problems. Both Nicolette and Raymond were always smiling (as was housekeeping, but unfortunately, I didn't get any names), and they truly wanted to make our stay comfortable and cared about us as guests. The location of the hotel is great. It is in a quiet part of the city, just outside the Presidio. Yet just two blocks down, the city thrives, with so many restaurant options we couldn't count them. The hotel is also close to many public transit stops. We never walked more than 3 blocks to or from any stop. A great bonus of the hotel location is that you can both hear and see the famous wild parrots of Telegraph Hill. The birds seem to like the trees at the Presidio. We really enjoyed watching them and hearing they as the flew over. I even managed to snap a couple of pictures while two of the birds chatted on power lines right next to the hotel. The only possible suggestion I could make to the hotel would be to expand the continental breakfast; fresh fruit would be a nice addition. I highly recommend this hotel and hope to have the pleasure of staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: EC8531
Reviews.Content: The day before my check-in date, I phoned the hotel to obtain information about early check-in options and spoke with Bruce, who proved extremely helpful with directions to the hotel on public transportation from SFO. Upon check-in, I was greeted by Shawn, who was also very friendly and gladly gave me tips on running routes to the Golden Gate Bridge and transportation to the Cliff House near Ocean Beach. I received the same level of customer service upon check-out the following morning when I requested a taxi in short notice and luggage storage while sightseeing that day. Thank you for making my stay in the Presidio area such a pleasant experience!

Reviews.Title: “An inexpensive hidden gem in an expensive city”
Reviews.Author: erskine49
Reviews.Content: Just a superb experience. A great room with all the facilities of a much more highly rated hotel...OK, so it's a bit dated and needs a bit of a 'tart-up'...but the service is absolutely first class and you'll want for nothing. Learn the bus timetables and you won't need a car...you're so conveniently close to the city. Just cant wait to get back there. Hint...no elevators so request a ground floor room if needed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, outstanding service, slightly let down by housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: ClamchowderUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Travelodge Presidio at the end of a 2 week US road trip in May. We found Raymond and his colleague (who's name I'm afraid escapes me) to be very welcoming and helpful. Raymond in particular, whom we dealt with most during our 2 night stay, really allowed us to make the most of our short stay in SF by providing us with clear and concise guidelines for traveling round the city, excellent recommendations for things to do/see, and generally helping us to hit the ground running. Really first class. There were a couple of minor things which let this motel down unfortunately: the cleanliness was generally good apart from right in the corners. Guys: if you have don't have a 'crevice tool' on your vacum then you probably ought to get a new one. Also the sheet on the bed, whilst perfectly clean, had some unsightly stains on which were a little off-putting. For the price of a new bed sheet and 5 minutes extra with the vacum I'd have had no complaints whatsoever about this place. For the money though, I don't think you can fault it, and I'd certainly recommend it to budget conscious friends.

Reviews.Title: “so worth it”
Reviews.Author: lisawesley13
Reviews.Content: This place is a little bit away from the main area of san francisco but only takes 45 minutes to walk to fishermans wharf and union square. the public transport system is right out side of the door, so you never have to worry about getting to and from any where. the rooms are clean and tidy and serviced daily. Next door there is a little shop where you can buy milk or things that you need. Raymond the concierge is amazing. I arrived early and he let me in my room straight away, he was so very helpful in day tours or free walking tours and also gave me a map with all the bus routes on it and explained how to get to and from places. If you needed anything Raymond was there to help. Bruce and nicolette were so helpful aswell, everyone greeted you with a smile and a hello. I will definately be staying there again..

Reviews.Title: “Best Travelodge Experience”
Reviews.Author: ACN2004
Reviews.Content: The moment we stepped in the lobby to check in we were greeted with a friendly smile from Tyler the General Manager and Bruce the front counter clerk. The team here at Travelodge were all great in helping us find things to do in San Fransisco. All that said a special THANKS to Raymond who is a wealth of knowledge for places to eat and places to avoid. He is experienced and someone you must get in touch with while staying at the Travelodge. Bruce was accommidationg in bring back my cleaner to my room. All over all hats off to Tyler, Bruce and Raymond :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, great location”
Reviews.Author: underneathy
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay at this particular Travelodge mostly because of it's location. I'm very familiar with San Francisco and knew that it would be a great spot in the City to stay. The staff is really nice and helpful and the rooms are immaculate so it was all a bonus. The bed almost takes over the whole room but it's very comfortable. Within walking distance is the Presidio, lots of bars and cafes, and Palace of Fine Arts. I plan on coming back here next time I'm in town.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable and Cheap”
Reviews.Author: avodoc
Reviews.Content: They got all the basics right: Quiet, clean and comfortable at a reasonable price. Although the rooms are tiny, they are appropriate for what you are paying. The bathrooms had been updated and the shower was nice and hot. I skipped the breakfast, which consisted of cold cereal, pre-packaged danish, pretty awful coffee (I did try that), tea and OJ. There are plenty of good restaurants nearby, we particularly like the Baker St. Bistro around the corner. Raymond, as reported, is a bundle of positve energy and a font of knowledge about San Francisco. One small complaint is that their parking lot fills up very quickly, so if you get a spot, it would be best to use public transportation if you want to keep your spot.

Reviews.Title: “Value,Friendly,Very helpful,Close to public Transport.”
Reviews.Author: junee_ferris
Reviews.Content: My Brother and I stayed 5 nights,recieving excellent service from the Management thru to All Receptionists. Although about 2 Miles out of the City and Fishermans Wharf, PublicTransport is Good.The Presidio area, is great for walking, and not far to the water front, and beautiful walking tracks. Not many eating places close. Good car parking was available for customers.

Reviews.Title: “Raymond, Renaissance Man & Hotelier Extraordinaire”
Reviews.Author: MOSWSpringfield_MO
Reviews.Content: I spent last week in San Francisco helping a friend close out her brother's estate. We stayed in her brother's apartment, which is just down the block from the Travelodge. We began each day with a visit to Raymond who, despite the fact that we were not paying guests, generously helped us plan our day's agenda, from bus routes to suggested destinations. This kind man not only helped us tend to bureaucratic details, he also helped us to have some fun in the midst of the work. His breadth of knowledge about the city was impressive but it was his passion for his chosen home that truly resonated with me. From Chagall to the Cowgirl Creamery, Balenciaga to french bakeries, Muir Woods to art appraisals, he served as our knowledgable & enthusiastic guide. Not only would I recommend the Travelodge to everyone I know, I will definitely stay there when next I visit the city. In fact, thanks to Raymond's enthusiasm & insider view of the city, I just may move there.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly & helpful staff, nice accommodations for a low price, great location.”
Reviews.Author: mjhoug
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to San Francisco and we didn't have any idea where to stay but we knew that we didn't want to spend a ton of money on a hotel room that we weren't going to spend a lot of time in. After reading the reviews and searching for deals, we decided on the Travelodge at the Presidio. It was a great choice and I would recommend it to my friends and family or anyone else who is going to San Francisco. The staff is extremely helpful and friendly and are always ready to help make your trip the best it can be. They seem to like their jobs, which makes a huge difference in how they treat their guests.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT LOCATION FRIENDLY STAFF!”
Reviews.Author: ashas0
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and it was a perfect base for our San Fran experience. The room we had was not huge but had 2 queen beds in it and was clean and comfortable and to be honest we were hardly in there during the day. The hotel is close to Chestnut street which has a whole array of great places to eat. What really made the accomodation were the really helpful staff, Bruce in particular was our favourite, he was full of inspiration for what what to do each day. We walked to fisherman's wharf to do the Alcatraz tour which I highly recommend, and caught a bus to Golden Gate park to do the Academy of science and the De young art museum. Thank you Bruce for making our trip so enjoyable and we hope to see you again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Best Motel in San Francisco...”
Reviews.Author: Krisk16
Reviews.Content: I live just north of the Golden Gate and my Mom was transferred down to San Francisco for open heart surgery. The hospital provided a list of accomodations with only 2 being pet friendly. I made reservations for the Travelodge and arrived late in the evening. The staff was very warm and inviting, making sure I had a safe place to park and that my 2 dogs (and myself) were welcome. They provided me with 2 doggy welcome bags that contained lots of treats my dogs LOVED and clean up bags too. The motel is perfectly located right next to the Presidio with lots of grass with safe walking. I was only able to stay 2 nights because they were booked for the 3rd night. I had to make reservations at the 'other' pet friendly motel on the list. It was in the Tenderloin (at the same price) and it was so scary. When I got to my room my bed was not even made. I checked out within 5 minutes and spent the night in my Mom's hospital room instead. I have been staying back at the Travelodge ever since. The staff is AMAZING! Everytime I see one of them they ask about my Mom and how she is doing. They love my dogs and ask for me to bring them to the office so they can pet them. I just love Bruce, Nikki and Raymond. I witness every morning over continental breakfast how helpful and friendly they are to all their guests (not just me). They listen to their guests needs and respond with the most appropriate suggestions. I rode MUNI for the first time with Nikki's help to the SF Giants game. The rooms are comfortable and clean. They have flat screen TV's and nicely decorated. I have a mini fridge to hold my leftovers from Liverpool Lil's right around the corner (YUM). Take it from me... I am local and very picky and I couldn't say one bad thing about this motel or staff. Feel free to contact me if you have any questions. I did read some old bad reviews here but the motel has been renovated since with new management and I couldn't imagine any issue that they would not handle in a professional and caring way. LOVE YOU GUYS! Oh and did I mention FREE PARKING in SF? And FREE WIRELESS INTERNET?

Reviews.Title: “Ask for Raymond”
Reviews.Author: bakotravelfan
Reviews.Content: We chose the Travelodge because of Trip Advisor reviews. The room was very quiet and the bed was comfortable. The room had a new flat-screen TV and a nice fridge. The free parking was wonderful. But what truly made our stay was Raymond, the man at the front desk at the Presidio Travelodge who knows all. While everyone on staff was helpful and courteous, Raymond helped us navigate across town using San Francisco bus lines, suggested wonderful restaurants (Home Plate for breakfast and Liverpool Lil's, a gem for dinner), gave us info on how to save money on museum visits, and simply made us feel welcome each and every time we saw him. His love of San Francisco inspired our own interest in the city; as a result, we actually visited places we had never made time for before. He seems to truly enjoy helping people, whether it is assisting them with the continental breakfast, helping visitors with directions, or simply welcoming them. (I also liked the world map in the breakfast room where people place a pin where they are from.) I told my husband that in all the years we have visited San Francisco, this visit was the first time I felt we actually enjoyed the city without rushing around trying to see all the regular tourist spots in one day. We were able to park our car at the hotel and see a lovely section of San Francisco. Raymond told us how much pride he takes in his job, and how he feels at home in San Francisco. Because he loves the city, he helped us feel at home there, too. Because of Raymond, we reserved rooms there again. He is a wonder--a Travelodge star--and frankly, he should work for the San Francisco Chamber of Commerce.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful STay”
Reviews.Author: Cassie40
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a safe and prestigious area of San Francisco, the Marina District. We enjoyed our clean, quiet, and large room, with free parking and breakfast. There was a refrigerator in the room, and breakfast was filling with cereals, danish, tea, coffee, and juice. The parking lot was small, but we always found a space. We used the free computer and printer in the business center. The staff was very helpful and gave us good directions, recommendations for food and help with planning our sightseeing. There is a Walgreens a block from the hotel, with food, snacks, etc.. The next block from the hotel is a trendy retail area with nice restaurants and shopping. They gave us a city map with bus routes outlined. The bus stop was only a 5 minute walk from the hotel. The area was safe and we were comfortable walking and using the bus system until late in the evening. There were many people walking outside and using the MUNI buses. We took the #30 bus from our stop to many areas of the city (Chinatown, North Beach-the Italian part, Union Square, and Fisherman's Wharf).
