We got a MUNI pass that included buses, cable cars and street cars. The adult individual bus fare is $2 each way, and cable cars and street cars are $5 each way. We also took the #28 bus from near the hotel to the Golden Gate Bridge and walked across the bridge and back. Gorgeous views! That bus goes through the Presidio and Golden Gate Park. The street cars follow the waterfront along all the piers to the Ferry Building. It is easy to find the bus stops by the shelters with digital displays for bus routes and times of arrival. The food and patries were wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, quiet location, close to Presidio and Marina”
Reviews.Author: outdoorathlete
Reviews.Content: I stayed here back in October 2010 for about 10 days while settling into SF for a relocation. The staff, Nicky and Tyler were friendly and helpful while I stayed there. There was an issue with noise in the room beside me and they were quick and efficient about finding me a quieter room. And when i finally left for my trip, they stored some luggage for me until I got back to move into my apartment. I have owed them a review since then and have been too busy to figure out this darned tripadvisor. But now it's done. If you need a budget business travel hotel that's close to the Marina but away from the main traffic noise, stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, good price and great staff”
Reviews.Author: Deyblan
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews of the hotel here before I made my reservation and I'm glad I did. This hotel has a great location a couple of blocks of muni and exploratorium. The room was clean and and had all I needed, the bed was realy comfy and the space was reasonable. There was a coffee maker wich I was thankful for, specially after a long and rainy day. But the staff was the best thing there, they were more than helpful with tips, directions and recomendations of stuff to do. Thanks so much to Bruce, Nicky and Tyler for all their help to make my visit a success.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe everything you read!!”
Reviews.Author: pinkzand
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel purely on the basis of what had been written here...which is a mistake I will not make again. These review greatly exaggerate the friendliness of the staff at this hotel with the exception of Nicolette who was lovely. We felt in general we were a nuisance if we went to the front desk to ask questions. We booked for 3 nights but found on night 2 we wanted to leave the area and move on, at breakfast we told Raymond of our intention to check out early and we were told we would not be billed for the third night, which was generous as we were not within the 24 hours cancellation period and our receipt ....having said that all 3 nights came off my card!!!!! By the time I found out we had already checked and paid into another hotel thinking we could afford it as our Presidio bill had been reduced. The thing that really got me was that if I had been told I had to pay for the third night I would have mentally deducted that amount and been satisfied to pay it as it was our choice to leave early. All in all we will not be returning to this hotel and we will definitely not be recommending it as one of the places to stay in SanFrancisco based on the customer service we received.

Reviews.Title: “People Make the Difference”
Reviews.Author: WestofSomewhere
Reviews.Content: Trip Advisor reviews led us to this location and we are pleased to pass along the praise! Our intent was to visit the Walt Disney Family Museum, located at the Presidio, and this motel is situated very near the Lombard Gate entrance. For access to the downtown and waterfront sights, we used a MUNI passport and rode the #30 bus everywhere we needed to go, about a 15-20 minute ride to Fisherman's Wharf. Our room was basic and a little on the small side for 3 adults, but was clean and comfortable. This appears to be an older property, but it is well maintained and a good value overall. Have to hand out kudos to Bruce at the front desk, who was more than helpful to us throughout our stay. He arranged a terrific city tour for us, as well as answered a myriad of questions very patiently. Based on his performance, as well as other reviews about helpful staff, it is clear this Travelodge pays attention to customer service.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT VALUE. EXCELLENT LOCATION. EXCELLENT SERVICE!”
Reviews.Author: KevinMcAllen
Reviews.Content: Grohe fixtures in the john. VERY clean comfortable rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: Britty86
Reviews.Content: I was a little worried about where this hotel would be located considering the rates at the time compared to all the other hotels. I was greatly surprised. The location is fantastic and central to anywhere you need to go if you are going to be near Fisherman's Wharf and great local eateries within a block or 2. Rooms were very cozy and amenities were nice. The staff member that checked me in was extremely pleasant and nice. If you are there during a weekday, there is a daycare at one of the houses on the left side (if you are looking at the rooms from the parking lot) and when the kids play outside they can get kind of noisy, but I am an early riser, so this was not a big deal for me. All in all, it was a nice stay and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a nice part of the city”
Reviews.Author: DR7301
Reviews.Content: Booked to stay here for 5 nights in February 2011 having read the positive reviews on Tripadvisor. I can honestly say that it lived up to all the positive comments and we were very pleased with our choice. Having never been to San Francisco before, Presidio was a good place to stay. Quiet, safe neighbourhood, close to restaurants on Chestnut Ave. Parking can be a little "tight" at busy times, but the friendly staff usually can squeeze you in! All credit to the staff at the Travelodge Presidio, they are all friendly and helpful. We hired a car and the location is only 5 mins from the Golden Gate Bridge and close enough to all the other "touristy" things to see, when you're on a short trip. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “You get more then what you are paying for...go midweek 20% discount”
Reviews.Author: secilb09
Reviews.Content: Going to be brutally honest, the good and the ok...For the price, worth it. Room was clean, bathroom had a little mold in the grout. But nothing disgusting, there was no microwave but didn't miss it. I am mother of two and the place was perfect. For little little ones the rooms do not have bathtubs, in case that poses a problem for some. We were two city blocks from the wharf, one block from the exploratorium and right next door to the best ny style pizza. The staff is super friendly, helpful and the breakfast is more then adequate. Cheerios, Circle K, Raisen Bran, oatmeal, danishes, orange juice, hot chocolate, and coffee is more than enough for breakfast. We stayed 4 nights and only spent $350 can't find that anywhere in SF, I dare you to try. So helpful and accommodating for medical patients. Nancy and Raymond were wonderful hosts and will definitely stay again. Might request some touch ups in the bathroom but other then that it was clean, quiet and in the most perfect location for the optimal "local" San Francisco experience.

Reviews.Title: “Best place for the value”
Reviews.Author: ontherios
Reviews.Content: We stay here often because the staff and location are wonderful. Staff makes a point to be helpful, current on city happenings and accommodating. They really make guests feel welcome. Raymond anticipates your arrival and caters to your tastes in suggestions. Tyler is a hands on manager. Nikki and Kevin are learning under excellent models of hosptality and are doing a fine job.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: fcmullins
Reviews.Content: This was the second time we've stayed there. It's not a 5 star hotel but it doesn't say it is either. The rooms are clean, beds are comfortable, heat and air works well and it's relatively convenient to attractions and public transportation. My only complaints are that the rooms although nice are a little small but that's not something that would keep me from staying there again. I would also like to see a vending machine with Coke products as I'm not too fond of Pepsi. The staff are all very friendly and helpful with tips concerning the city and the best ways to get around and things to see. Should we have the oppourtunity to visit San Francisco again chances are we'll do our best to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay again.”
Reviews.Author: FrizzB
Reviews.Content: Fast check in, helpful staff. Minor problems were corrected by maint. in a short time. Most rooms average size for S.F. Our room, #302 was postage stamp size but liveable. Room #301 looked twice the size. Very good location, about a block off the main drag. Most Lombard motels suffer from noise due to traffic and night life, but not here, very quiet! Small grocery right next door. Great restaurant and bar just around the corner, Liverpool Lil's. Room was very clean, well cared for, but you could tell it has been around. Had to put a phone book under one end of the desk just to level it, sagging floor. Overall it was a great deal for the price and in a very safe neighborhood. Will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, great location if you want to be near Presidio, Golden Gate Bridge”
Reviews.Author: MangoTango007
Reviews.Content: The staff here is the story. They go well beyond the call of duty to accommodate the needs of their guests. I loved getting "locals" knowledge from Raymond, it was very helpful in planning our very limited time in San Francisco. The hotel is located at the entrance to the Presidio; just a block away is a bus that takes you to Union Square. The property is a bit worn around the edges but was clean. Don't expect "luxury," just great service with a smile. I would recommend the hotel -- with conditions. I must comment on something odd that happened while we were there. A man, we're assuming he was the owner of the hotel, came into the "hospitality room" where we were seated and proceeded to SCREAM at an employee who was using a computer in the computer room. That was most unpleasant and not in character with the otherwise excellent service at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Why can't all hotels offer such great service?”
Reviews.Author: dh1120
Reviews.Content: I was in SF over a weekend to see the Van Gogh, et al exhibit at the deYoung. I chose this hotel on the basis of the reviews of its customer service and the relative proximity to Golden Gate Park. While a guest there, I decided to leave my car at the hotel and take public transportation. Both Nikki and Raymond were extremely helpful not only in providing the simplest ways to get to where I wanted to go by public transportation, but also in giving me sightseeing ideas as well. I would stay there again but upgrade to a larger room. My only (minor) suggestions for the hotel based on my experience would be to include an iron and ironing board in every room as well as some kind of protein (such as hard-boiled eggs) with breakfast. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Simple, Comfortable with Most Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Mamabear56
Reviews.Content: While it is a bit off the beaten path, at the Lombard Gate of the Presidio, it is convenient to several main bus lines to get anywhere you might want to go as a tourist. The beds were extremely comfortable with down quilts and fluffy pillows and it's location made it very quiet at night. Although, I have to say, the bathroom was very small as were the towels, and the floor could have been a bit cleaner. The staff was very friendly and incredibly helpful, giving us tips on how to get around and they made up for any deficiencies of this little, hidden, and very affordable motel.

Reviews.Title: “Safe location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: valerie019
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a short stay in SF and found this hotel on Trip Advisor, it was in an excellent location of San Francisco, near the Presidio and in walking distance to the Marina. It was necessary to take a bus to the Wharf and many of the tourist sites, but felt it was worth it to stay in a safe place for the money. The staff were exceptionally helpful in giving us directions and recommendations on where to eat, bus stop locations, etc. The beds were very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC home away from home! A most enjoyable stay!”
Reviews.Author: mia1313
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel were helpful, extremely knowlegeable about San Francisco and all the avaialble attractions and restaurants. I was very impressed by their enthusiasm and helpfulness and sound advice! Raymond was probably the best hotel manager I have ever met. No request was too complicated or unreasonable. We were travelling from Singapore for a two week stay in SF and the staff made our stay truly terrific -- it was such a great experience for us. The cleaning staff were also incredibly professional, hlepful and courteous but most of all EFFICIENT! My hat goes off the David who took great care of us and our room! Our stay was truly memorable and pleasant because of the great and friendly staff. Their extra effort and kindess made all the difference. The hotel is very basic and very comfortable and even though it was fully booked for most of our stay, we always managed to find parking -- a big relief! A terrific value for the money in a great location! I will stay here everytime we go to SF! HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

Reviews.Title: “People makes the difference”
Reviews.Author: Fer196690
Reviews.Content: This is a correct hotel but the service is one of the finest I have ever had in my life travelling around the world: Richar, Ray, Nicky, Bruce and Stephen were marvellous. Always with a smile and helping in everything. Tyler the general manager was super-friendly on the phone when we made the reservations and personally when we met him. What a tremendous Team to run a hotel¡¡¡¡ Thanks

Reviews.Title: “If You Love San Francisco-- This is the Place”
Reviews.Author: RogerRamjett
Reviews.Content: We had lived in the area, so we know the City... Both before and after, we have stayed at this Travelodge over 30 years... but not in 10 and so we wondered, but from Richard booking our room like a pro to Nikki who was always there to help (she even supplied an umbrella) it was a delight. Tyler Shannon, the GM, runs a happy and serving staff.... If there were 10 stars, we'd give it. Walk to the beautifully renovated Presidio, Disney Family Museum, National Cemetery, Crissy Field, Palace of Fine Arts and if you're hearty, the Wharf. Close to everything... Rooms are clean, with that superb updated exterior (very SF).....and an excellent value but it is the staff and the location... We cannot wait for our next trip this spring

Reviews.Title: “Stay here - it's great”
Reviews.Author: scubaroo70
Reviews.Content: Located at the end of Lombard St with 5 bus routes witin a block. Off street paking and a good breakfast of cereal, muffins & danish with coffee. Excellent location for Fisherman Wharf etc. Restruants nearby and feel safe out at night. Raymond at the front desk is extremely helpful and full of advice and local knowledge A local Coin Laundry is easy to find. I recommend this hotel to everyone who wishes a clean, cheap and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet, perfectly located--and excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: cleverfool
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I recently stayed at the Travelodge at the Presidio--in connection with our attending a two-day hip hop dance fest at the Palace of Fine Arts. Prior to making the reservation, I spoke with some of the hotel's staff members about the hotel and things to see and do in the immediate area. I wanted to put together a really fun trip, where most everything would be within walking distance, so we wouldn't waste a lot of time driving around in traffic. To that end, the staff, and in particular Raymond Archer, the Front Desk Concierge, was extremely helpful, so much so that he ought to receive a raise--no joke. In most cases, he provided me with first hand knowledge and reviews of Marina specific restaurants, bars, and clubs, including A16, Izzy's Steakhouse, Liverpool Lil's, Mamacita's, and Silver Clouds Restaurant & Karaoke Bar. He even made a point of visiting the Hi-Fi Lounge after work one evening in order to let me know if it was the kind of dance place my girlfriend and I would be interested in going to. Then, he shared a number of websites, including sfstation, sfcityguides, sf.funcheap, and yelp, all of which helped me put together an itinerary around our two-day dance show. In addition, Raymond talked to me about bus routes and tours, including the Presidigo, the Wave Organ (a little known but really cool S.F. landmark near the hotel), architectural walking tours, including Alamo Square, and the Lyon St. Stairs--with some incredible views of the bay. In short, he was very professional and thorough in answering all of my questions and ensured that we had both a great stay at the Travelodge and a really good time in the Marina District. He provided the kind of exceptional customer service that, unfortunately, you just don't see/experience that often anymore. Thanks, Raymond--I really appreciate it.

Reviews.Title: “TOP-NOTCH SERVICE AND ACCOMODATIONS”
Reviews.Author: libertycabell
Reviews.Content: For more than 2 days and nights, the management and staff of Travelodge Presidio provided both excellent service and first class accomodations in a perfect location for a reasonable price, and part of Wyndham Rewards. I will go back there every time, and take my family. Thank you, including Raymond Archer and the whole desk staff, who were most helpful and responsive to the customer! Benjamin Cabell

Reviews.Title: “Great location, reasonable price and really nice people”
Reviews.Author: guyadams
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay if you don't need the 4 star type of hotel. The free parking makes it a great deal. While I visited the staff were really friendly and helpful. It was clean and in a good neighborhood close to many good restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in San Francisco for Service, location, price, quiet.”
Reviews.Author: laweber707
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff. You feel like family by the time you leave. Raymond was a delight. Made sure we got the best room possible. Gave us great directions for bus lines. Helped us get our etickets printed for flights. Raymond and Tyler both went out of their way to make sure we had everything we needed. Tyler walked us around the corner to show us where the nearest restaurant was. We were able to park our car for free and had easy access to public transportation. Driving and parking in SF is insane and costly. Most hotels in the area charge $35 or more to just park your car. They even allowed us to leave our car before check-in time, so that we could do some sight seeing early in the day. Though the rooms are small, they're clean and the beds are quite comfortable. Prices are reasonable, (though a little more on the weekends.) I would absolutely recommend a stay here anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Prepaid Guaranteed Room didn't get me a Room Here”
Reviews.Author: ctex99
Reviews.Content: I prepaid for my room through a travel website because I knew that I would be arriving late (Midnight). I even included a note on my reservation indicating that it would be 11 PM at the earliest that I would arrive. To their credit, they called some of the nearby hotels and found me a hotel room that was decent however it was on a major thoroughfare and the traffic noise was horrible. This cost me a day of my 5 day vacation because of the bad first night.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful staff at secluded Travelodge”
Reviews.Author: Columbo077
Reviews.Content: Recently my husband, teenage son and dog, (yes a dog friendly hotel in SanFrancisco! ) spent 4 nights at the Presidio Travelodge, not to be mistaken for the other 2 or 3 Travelodges on Lombard Street. This one is tucked away on the West end of the street literally steps away from the Presidio gate. The night desk person who checked us in was Nikki and she made absolutely sure we were comfortable with our room. She brought us an extra light and a doggie treat bag for our dog. She assured us the neighborhood was safe and over the course of the next 3 nights cheerfully greeted us when we arrived back at the hotel, tired from a day of exploring and sightseeing. She even came to our car (we had to park around the corner when the lot was full) to see if we needed help carrying anything or help with the dog. Ray, the day person, helped our son locate places to skateboard and gave us driving directions so some out of the way places. The motel is gracefully aging and the rooms are very small, there was free wi-fi, continental breakfast, extra coffee for the room, and free parking! The fridge and microwave were very helpful as we had taken some food from home to enjoy while on vacation. We will no-doubt return. Thanks again Nikki & Ray for all your help and friendliness!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: TheRayWatcher
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is great. Walking distance to great restaurants, night life, Palace of Fine Arts, and you can almost see the Golden Gate Bridge! We stayed for 5 nights and it was great. They have remodeled some and had a comfy bed. Parking was tight but for ~ $90/night, you can not beat this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I didn't know San Francisco could be so easy.”
Reviews.Author: sandyw58
Reviews.Content: Ours was a very brief stay - just one night. Drove into the easy parking, marveled at the wonderful location, and then set off on a comfortable and delightful walking tour of the area. I too, agree completely with all the good things said before me. I didn't know SF could be so easy - for price, for transportation, and for comfort and security. Oh yes, we were there on the night the Giants won the World Series. It was fun to stand on the balcony and watch the celebrations in the friendly neighborhood and when I was tired I went into my room, closed the door, and not a sound could be heard.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: HI-Garden-Gal
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Travelodge Presideo very much. Raymond, at the front desk, is "Mr. Travelodge" himself. He was cheerful, helpful, friendly and knew so much about the bus routes and things to do in the city. The room was comfortable (a little small, but this is San Francisco!) and we had a great night's sleep. Would definitely recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: PeterSurf
Reviews.Content: Tyler and Raymond went out of their way from recommending restaurants to locating a taxi cab. I would highly recommend staying at the property.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Golden Gate”
Reviews.Author: cleoder
Reviews.Content: This clean motel is located relatively close to attractions. The room was equipped with fridge, coffee maker, flat screen TV king bed & a safe. WiFi connection is free & good. as is the free continental breakfast served each morning. Parking is free but limited to early comers. Restaurants are located close by in the good safe neighbourhood. Tour buses come to pick you up and drop off after. Tyler, the desk clerk, is high on life and can't do enough for you. Every hotel should have a Tyler. The parking area is covered by security cameras. By the way this hotel is located on famous Lombard Street.

Reviews.Title: “Tyler made our day!”
Reviews.Author: MeandererStill
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a medical procedure at the SF VA. We had made reservations at another motel for the night however upon checking it out we realized that the location at the end of the Judah line would be too noisy. We had driven past this motel earlier and it looked green, clean and attractive from the street. Googled it and spoke to Tyler. We had a king room in a very quiet location in 20 minutes. Amazing service on a night the Giants were in the playoffs and most things in town were booked. Good price. Comfortable bed and I slept very well even for a person in a heart moniter. Nice furnishings and very clean with fluffy pillows. Both Tyler and Raymond were chipper and friendly whenever we spoke to them and very helpful with food recommendations. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Location,price and quietness were great for San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: chipjane077
Reviews.Content: The location on Lombard st. is one block from the Presidio(a quiet section as Rt.101 turns off Lombard to enter the GG Bridge). The clerk, Tyler was a great help in planning our stay. The price included parking, but there are limited spaces(fewer spaces than rooms) so check in early and take public transit back to downtown.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel Was Instrumental To an Awesome Vacation in San Francisco!!!!”
Reviews.Author: SFOLover
Reviews.Content: First of all I want to say that Tyler (The General Manager?) was extremely professional, friendly, and helpful with our travel arrangements. He never asked personal questions, but the probing questions that he did ask were instrumental in helping us plan our trip. He was very knowledgeable about the local transit system and sites of interest around the region (from Point Reyes in the north to Santa Cruz in the south). I believe that good managers also tend to hire individuals who are very much like them. All of the other staff members were exceptional. You cannot beat the location of this hotel. We could virtually walk out of our door and walk right onto any city bus. Lots of places to eat, the Presidio, The Golden Gate Bridge, and the Fisherman's Wharf were only 5 minutes away (either by walking or by bus). My wife and I felt entirely safe in the neighborhood. We had a wonderful trip to San Francisco and if we ever return we will definitely be staying at the Travelodge Presidio. THANK YOU!!

Reviews.Title: “QUIET, park it (free) - transportation to ANYWHERE across street”
Reviews.Author: denisehammett
Reviews.Content: All the staff - Tyler, Raymond, Niki, Richard - are very knowledgeable about the city and how to get there. We were here for 10 days due to medical issues but were able to get out everyday and enjoy some of what the city has to offer. We parked our car (for free) and never drove the entire 10 days. All transports across the street. Unfortunately my husband got something out of the car and left a light on and ten days later it wouldn't start...but Raymond came to our rescue and went out of his way to get us up and running all with the best attitude. Iam a very light sleeper but it was so quiet, I slept very well, felt safe, and the location was perfect for need to get to UCSF. Rooms are small but so are they on cruise ships!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and safe, with an AMAZING staff!”
Reviews.Author: nathuhbelle
Reviews.Content: Everyone who we came across at this hotel was immensely helpful in giving us any assistance that we needed. They provided directions, food recommendations, daily activity suggestions, and just had an all around great demeanor. They seemed to genuinely care that their guests were well taken care of and had a good time in San Francisco. They were incredibly well informed about transportation and various activities around the city. Our room was very clean and well-maintained. This hotel has a great location immediately adjacent to the Presidio and a fairly short walk to the Golden Gate Bridge. It's located next to some very nice residential areas and always felt safe. A continental breakfast was provided which consisted of various cereals, pastries, oatmeal, juice, milk, tea, and coffee. It was fantastic to be able to have a quick bite to eat before heading out for the day. All in all -- a super place with an amazing staff for a great price!

Reviews.Title: “I am staying here when I go back to San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: memorylost777
Reviews.Content: Tyler the manager was amazing. He was polite and ever so helpful. When I go back to San Fran I will definitely stay at the Travelodge. The service and room and price dominates every other hotel I have ever stayed at. They have a customer for life!

Reviews.Title: “Our stay was a pleasant, memorable experience.”
Reviews.Author: rosewood65
Reviews.Content: The location was great and the staff went out of their way to help us out. Our gracious host, Tyler, willingly offered us adivice on where to go, the easiest connections and buses to take, etc, what highlights to see, etc. He was very polite and friendly. We'd go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great nights sleep”
Reviews.Author: Louvul
Reviews.Content: We loved the location and the staff was very helpfull. The limited parking spaces were a problem but on street parking was close. Take public transportation once you park. Much easier on both ends. The room was clean and much better than what we read about in other reviews for the price. The Beds were great, the neighborhood was quiet and we slept well. It wasn't fancy but the kids were comfortable and enjoyed being here. We would stay here again, hopefully with enough time to enjoy the area around the hotel more.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Exceptional staff”
Reviews.Author: Mkrt1972
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location and incredible value for money. We chose this hotel because of the reviews of others and the free parking offered. We were able to purchase the Muni passes from the front desk and was given an in depth explanation of the best routes and buses which were all in walking distance for us. The staff were amazing. They all had such enthusiasm and enjoyed helping their guests. A really big thanks to young Nikki Kraft for helping us plan a route to Palm Springs avoiding Los Angeles. Nikki dropped what she was busy doing and spent 20 minutes planning a route and certainly went that extra mile in helping us.

Reviews.Title: “perfectly quiet place to get sleep at end of a long vacation day”
Reviews.Author: bluebear0928
Reviews.Content: very quiet - number one thing we wanted - older hotel - so very basic - but don't let that fool you! the location is good - the breakfast - while not much variety - was plentiful and fresh and we did not have to worry about there being nothing left if we were a bit later arriving. The staff was terrific - a special thanks to Raymond at the desk for all his spectacular help! Safe area - convenience store and a couple of food choices right next door. IHOP 3 block walk as well. All in all a good stay!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay”
Reviews.Author: Duggs
Reviews.Content: As mentioned on several previous reviews, the staff at this hotel are fantastic. Both Raymond and his female colleague are the friendliest people you could ever hope to meet. Upon check-in Raymond kindly upgraded us to a larger room having seen the amount of luggage we had in tow and then enquired about what we wanted to do in SF. (Hint: Room 301) He completely arranged a fantastic city tour for us, telling us exactly where to be and at what time. The hotel is tucked neatly down one end of Lombard Street and we didn't hear a thing all night, no traffic noise whatsoever. Beds were extremely comfortable. We travelled for nearly 3 weeks around the West Coast and this was the ONLY location that offered free internet access using their in-house PC. A very nice bonus. Free parking also. The walk from the hotel to Fishermans Wharf will take about 45-60 mins but its a safe and enjoyable one. Note: IHOP is just down the road also, a good stop for a full breakfast etc. Another "buzz" for me, as I found out on Raymonds recommended tour, is that the start of the famous car chase in Steve McQueen's Bullet was filmed literally 100yds down the street from the Hotel. (I know as I've since watched it on YouTube). Nothing more to add than to say "Do your self a favour, save a fortune and stay here".

Reviews.Title: “Ideal spot for San Francisco stay”
Reviews.Author: DMW1970
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with wife and 6 year-old son for two days SF sightseeing. Decent, clean rooms at a very competitive price with free parking. Located on a very quiet end of Lombard Street next to the Presidio with very easy bus access to all parts of the city. Continental breakfast was as expected for similar stays we have had in California - coffee, juice, cereals and a pastry or two. Many thanks go to Raymond, who is extremely knowledgeable about SF, its sights and things to do. He helped us with many aspects of our sightseeing and went out of his way to help us on more than one occassion. We will be staying there the next time we visit San Fransisco, that's for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Location and price is great with excellent staff teamwork and management.”
Reviews.Author: ontherios
Reviews.Content: Tyler Shanahan, general manager, has extensive knowledge of this hotel's overall operation and a good rapport w/ the public and his staff. Raymond Archer, reservations and front desk agent, is very positive, curteous, helpful, hardworking and goes the extra mile to resolve any and all problems and requests. He works diligently to improve the hotel's facility and always looks to add to guests' comfort, offering tips on this areas current entertainment choices. His knowledge exgtends well beyond his job description. He is a terrifiic resource for hotel guests as well as for building this hotel's repeat business.. There are several places in the Presidio location but as frequent visitors to SF, we only stay here because of Tyler Shanahan and Raymond Archer's superior efforts to satisfy our needs.

Reviews.Title: “You can find no better hospitality staff at any price in the U.S.A.”
Reviews.Author: squ1
Reviews.Content: We found this hospitality gem by accident when another motel where we used to stay in the Marina district went out of business: how lucky can you get! We've returned year after year -- not just because of the Presidio/Marina location but because the staff is SO WONDERFUL! No matter what you need to know about the city, Tyler and Ray can give you great guidance. No matter what you need to make your stay more comfortable, they always go out of their way at any time of day or night. Really, you can't pay for this kind of service: these guys are the best!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable, clean and very accomodating staff”
Reviews.Author: HPGHCalistogaCA
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Presidio Travelodge for leisure travel and my husband stays there regularly for business. The location is a perfect jumping off point for the great restaurants of the Marina neighborhood, sightseeing in the historic Presidio, walking across the Golden Gate Bridge, visiting the Legion of Honor. Also, it is just a short distance from Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, The Walt Disney Family Museum, The Exploratorium, and the Cable Car Museum. The rooms are clean and the staff is very accommodating and there to help you with your needs.

Reviews.Title: “A bargain in SF”
Reviews.Author: txorig
Reviews.Content: We’ve now stayed here 3 different times and figured we should go ahead and write a review. Our first visit was in May and it was just ok. Family just moved to the Presidio and this hotel is literally walking distance to their place. Bonus for us is the location. It is an older place, but I have to say, it really is kept very clean. The old building and the old décor account for the cheaper priced rooms which is without a doubt a bargain. Free parking and wireless thrown in the mix and it’s almost a steal. Forget the breakfast (cold cereal, teeny cups for coffee and packaged Danish) and realize the rooms are not your standard size and you’re fine. The room we got was in the back (306) so the noise of Lombard eluded us. Unfortunately, the room was one of the oldest ones. There were some minor annoyances. The room is small, but we could live with that. The bathroom was very much in need of work with the shower door wobbly, but functional. The window in the bathroom (a bonus to us to have fresh air) would not stay open so we propped the ice bucket under it to hold it open. We were there one night so we didn’t report it (we should have) however they sent us a Travelodge survey after our stay and I was honest about the condition of the room. I got a phone call within a day of filling out the survey. I have to admit they seemed genuinely interested in my feedback. We stayed again this past week and the room we got this time was much better. Still same old décor and small, but the bathroom was remodeled with the shower stall new, granite tops and a vanity with some room to store toiletries. We had a problem with noise just as we were turning in for the night and this time we did report it. It ended up being the plumbing in the room above us. They came immediately, but because of the hour they were not able to do anything about the problem. They discounted our room and the toilet upstairs was fixed the next day and we had no more problems. On our third visit we were back in room 306 with the old bathroom. Raymond, the manager, told us that they were in the process of refurbishing all the bathrooms and the next phase will be to replace the furniture. They truly do seem to be upgrading the hotel to higher standards. All in all, you cannot beat the price, location and service.

Reviews.Title: “Really pleased”
Reviews.Author: mpkljp2011
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights and we were happy with our stay and the price. The location is quiet and some good restaurants are within walking distance. To see the main sights you need to either use the car or public transport. One tip is that the car parking in SF is cheaper for the day if you arrive early ie. before 9am. We paid $12 to park all day from 8.30am near the Alcatraz departures on Pier 33. Breakfast was fairly basic with pastries and cereals, tea, coffee and fruit juice. Lacking toast and bagels. The free parking is limited and one night we had to park on the street as we were late back to the motel at 9.30pm. Overall happy and would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great place.”
Reviews.Author: TexItalian
Reviews.Content: The place is old and some of the rooms are cramped but the Travelodge at the Presidio is a bargain in an very expensive city. The front desk personnel are all A+ people and the location near the Presidio is relatively quiet. The free parking is a huge plus and the free i-net is fast. The breakfast is adequate but the dining area cannot handle more than about a dozen folks. All in all a very good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, free parking, but watch out for group bookings & next-door pre-school”
Reviews.Author: Victoria098
Reviews.Content: Good value for a last-minute booking to take grandson to Golden Gate Park museums. Location near Marina/Presidio is nice. Quiet back street. But checked in same night as group of motorcycle riders who used the parking lot to party. All quiet by bedtime but made for a noisy evening -- we left to escape. Don't underestimate the value of the free pkg --it's a huge asset in SF. Rooms are somewhat dated but clean w. good beds & vary: ours was cramped & dark, our daughter-in-law's was light & spacious. Same price. Front desk staff friendly & helpful. Good restaurants to walk to: Baker Street Bistro around the corner exc! As is A16 on Chestnut Street. Either plan to rise early or to enjoy the sounds of children playing: pre-school next door lets kids out to play about 8:30.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: jyount328
Reviews.Content: Front desk is very friendly and accomidating. They were great in getting a cab "On time" very early in the morning. Quick, easy and great service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value,great location,friendly staff,clean”
Reviews.Author: Sawtooth9
Reviews.Content: Raymond was most helpful! Great location for the Presido area and the golden gate bridge. The value was great, the room was claen. Safe place to park and see SF.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS STAFF-GREAT LOCATION-CLEAN- 5STARS!!!”
Reviews.Author: AlwaysTrvln
Reviews.Content: I came to the Travelodge with not much to expect, except it was a "Travelodge"...however I was INCORRECT. This is a FABULOUS Travelodge. Not just the staff, the location but the ROOMS! They are all upgraded, have flat screen tv's. FREE BREAKFAST! Who does that now-a-days? FREE...something for FREE in this world...AND PARKING...FREEEEE..IN SAN FRAN...go stay at another hotel and you will pay at the LEAST $25 a NIGHT for parking. The staff is absolutely FANTASTIC! Raymond at the front desk, took time to xerox maps from the map book, highlight the areas I was going to be driving AS WELL as printing out the directions from mapquest, or whatever they have on their front desk computers. I was scared to drive in the city b/c of the one way streets, hills, trolleys etc. He directed me in the most simple possible way to get to my destination. Tyler the morning person (at the front desk), was soo kind to me when I called and had several questions as to where the hotel was in radius of other places, parking questions, food/restaurant advice etc...They are both great! Have to say...IF you don't want to be in the crowded city but close enough for a $10 cab ride...STAY HERE..it's quiet, convieniantly located...JUST PERFECT! Thank you Travelodge for a great visit!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Clean!, Friendly Staff, Quiet and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: GYG-2010
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here for business twice and have not been disappointed. It is right next to the Lombard gate of the Presidio and very close to the Marina, Ft. Mason, Palace of Governors/Exploratorium, Disney Family Museum and all the other cool stuff at the Presidio. There are great restaurants, reasonably priced that you can walk to for meals. Richard was especially helpful the last time I stayed. The staff is always courteous and helpful. The motel is NON-SMOKING, all rooms, and they smell fresh. A lot of other places in this price-range say you're getting non-smoking when you actually end up with smoking. I have not stayed here with my family but I would if necessary given the cleanliness and value.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and customer service”
Reviews.Author: BeaTucson
Reviews.Content: The location is near the Presidio and very quite. The rooms are rather small but adequate. However, the customer service is outstanding. The people on the hotel staff are very friendly, knowledgeable, and extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: DennisCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Hard to beat for the price. We had an inside room surrounded by 3 rooms ( to noisy at 1:30am), so be sure you get a room on the 3rd floor at the end. Being within walking distance of the Presidio Social Club couldn't be better.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest staff and exceptional care”
Reviews.Author: vikkig94123
Reviews.Content: During apartment renovations, I had an extended stay at the Travelodge at the Presidio with my pug dog. Tyler, Ray, Nicki, and Andres took great care of me and my dog. Professional, friendly, caring, courteous doesn't even begin to describe their level of service. The room was clean and very quiet. The staff became my temporary family - I still live in the neighborhood and walk my dog over to say hello - she won't let me walk to the Presidio without pulling me in the direction of the Travelodge. I highly recommend it for your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Price, Quiet Location Yet Convenient”
Reviews.Author: KatFrazz
Reviews.Content: I, too, picked this place after reading online reviews. My sister and I stayed here 5 nights and it looks like they've recently upgraded the rooms (new carpet, bedding, bathroom sink area). There's not a lot of counter space in the rooms, but I loved the thermostat controlled air conditioning. I had to strategically clip our curtains closed to keep it dark in the room, but there was little to no noise! Bed was super comfy. The hotel is about 2 blocks off Lombard Street. About 4 blocks from the hotel on Chestnut Street there are a lot of restaurants and shops to check out. There is a MUNI bus stop right across from the hotel, and one just a few blocks away for a different line. They have free parking (BONUS!) but the spots are really tight! Luckily we were in a Bug. Free continental breakfast was enough for us. I usually skip breakfast anyway. The front desk guy in the mornings always asked how our day was and would tell us about any festivals or cool events going on. He is by far one of the best frontline personnel I've seen (and I work in the hospitality industry!). After shopping for a long time I found the specials on their website were the best prices. There was a discrepancy between what I had reserved (price) and what I was charged. Turns out there is a small fee for use of the safe that you can decline at check-in (I didn't notice it on the check-in sheet I signed) but I emailed the hotel and they refunded the money since we didn't use the safe. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “quiet location with first class tourism information included”
Reviews.Author: 2fortravel_10
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was a pleasure due to the personal service provided by the staff -- Ray, Tyler and Nikki all enhanced our stay by offering advice as to what to see and how to get there. We found the public transport easily accessible and many sites and services within walking distance as well.

Reviews.Title: “We were VERY pleased with Travelodge at the Presidio”
Reviews.Author: BuckyBadgeragogo
Reviews.Content: Trip Advisor reviews we had read, before our visit to the city, convinced us to stay at this Travelodge. We were not disapointed in our overall experience. The location was great. It was in a very quiet and safe area of town. The desk clerks were "exceptionally helpful". Raymond was there our first evening and we couldn't have asked for a more helpful and enthusiastic host. Our breakfasts were adequate. The room was average in quality, but fine for the money.. Our location was near bus routes, the Bridge and Presidio Park. Most of Lombard Street is very busy, however, this particluar stretch of Lombard is not on 101, hence traffic is very minimal. Our only frustration was with the TV set. The volume was adjusted so low that we really found it difficult to use. After a long day of sightseeing, we had hoped to relax in the evening, but the TV was virtually useless. That said, we still highly recommend the Travelodge at the Presidio. We hope you enjoy your stays.

Reviews.Title: “By far, the nicest place for the price, location & staff anywhere in SF.”
Reviews.Author: ontherios
Reviews.Content: The quiet street & park access is great. Public transportation let's us park the car for our whole visit unless we head out of the city. It's the staff which really keeps the place humming and provides everything possible for guest enjoyment. They watch out for your belongings [once we left for the day w/ car doors & trunk open which they noticed & locked for us]. They are the best source for local events & info on everything 'city' you need to know. Tyler, Raymond & Nikki get extra cudos for going above & beyond in assistance and pleasant attitude, even at the end of a long shift. If you have a YMCA membership elsewhere, you can get a discount to the nearby Presidio YMCA for $3/day.

Reviews.Title: “We found a little gem in a handy neighborhood.”
Reviews.Author: CraftyGrammy4
Reviews.Content: The Presidio Travelodge turned out to be close to the sites we wanted to see, namely the Presidio and the trails in the area. The Tuscan decor and newly re-done bathroom made for a pleasant stay. The real jewel at this site is Raymond who can tell guests how to get anywhere in the city because he has been there himself. He could even tell us travel time on public transportation to get from one location to another. If you have a question, Raymond can answer it! A very service-oriented location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Madysmum
Reviews.Content: Nicky and Tyler are very helpful and courteous, the hotel although a tad small for 4 of us was great very convenient and clean , we will definitely be back

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: Gloryperipatetic
Reviews.Content: Exceptional service and local knowledge from Tyler Shanahan and Raymond Archer and such a pleasure to stay at the hotel with such warm and welcoming professionals. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Location, service, price!”
Reviews.Author: Peripatetical
Reviews.Content: Those are our criteria and the Presidio Travelodge meets the all. The location is great, a half block east of the Presidio with easy driving to Golden Gate Park or Downtown The staff is unbelievably friendly and helpful. When was the last time a front desk clerk offered to help you with your bags? The price is extraordinary, $100 or under in SF! (look in the coupon book found at rest stops and TICs). The rooms are small by new motel standards, but who spends much time in their room here? The lovely kingsize beds take up a lot of room, but they're worth it. Over the years we've been coming here the facilities have constantly been upgraded. Our room was freshly painted and spotless. The bathroom was new. The only drawback is that there isn't a parkng spot for every room, the place was built before the news standards were adopted, but the staff trys to fit you in. We shall return! PS: try the Baker Street Bistro just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Staff”
Reviews.Author: davebrooklyn
Reviews.Content: I have to say I was totally blown away by the service here -- Ray at the front desk is truly a 5 star hotel kind of guy. Great that Travelodge has him working here.. Dave

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: CatmandooMD
Reviews.Content: Yes, the front desk staff is wonderful. However, during our four-day stay in late January, the bed was not made once (although the coverlet was pulled over the pillows) nor were the trash cans in the room emptied. The room was small , looked tired, and felt dirty. The continental breakfast was limited to a choice of three dried boxed cereals and prepackaged pastries. Pluses include the hotel's location, right next to the magnificent Presidio, a short walk to great shops and local restaurants, and close to the Golden Gate Bridge.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Incredible Staff”
Reviews.Author: SuperNudge
Reviews.Content: My partner and I spent the last 2 days of our USA road trip in San Francisco. Based on the reviews on Trip Advisor we picked The Presidio Travelodge. When we arrived (no reservation) Raymond (The man!) checked us in, told us where the best places for dinner where and sorted us out for activities for the next 2 days. To say that Raymond has an enthusiastic attitude for the city is an understatement! He was the most helpful person from our entire trip.The room was big enough, bed was the best we had slept in all trip, having a fridge was a bonus. The free parking and Wi-fi were just icing on the cake. After checking out Raymond let us leave our rental car in the car park for a couple of hours so we could finish our great open-top bus tour. Great way to end our road trip, have already recommended to friends who will be in San Francisco soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great lodging in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: FriskyfromFrisco
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Travelodge at the Presidio. Great value for the $! The staff was helpful directing us to places of interest. We enjoyed an Evening Alcatraz tour. Toured the Embarcadero and had dinner at Boudin's Bistro. Dinner and a Concert at Yoshi's of San Francisco. Toured the Presidio, Muir Woods. Rode the cable cars and found the mass transit system (called Bart) to be very efficient! This was my first visit to San Francisco and I have to revisit.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: spdykyla
Reviews.Content: We arrived around 9pm and Raymond Archer checked us in. He was SO enthusiastic about the city that we decided to stay two nights instead of one! He squared us away with maps, directions, bus schedules- everything we needed to get around without taking our car. The room was perfect for us- we had two queen beds for two adults and a ten year old at a reasonable price. We had two great days and nights thanks to Ray!

Reviews.Title: “The Presidio Travelodge proves to be perfect.”
Reviews.Author: artichokequeen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to San Francisco for a relaxing, romantic weekend and found the accommodations at the Presidio Travelodge perfect. From a free parking spot to gracious hospitality by the staff, we were consistently pleased with the hotel amenities. The hotel staff provided us with a list of current activities, restaurants, and transportation suggestions. I would highly recommend this hotel to any traveler seeking affordable and note worthy lodging, knowledgeable staff and the excitement of being in the heart of San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Clean Rooms, Free Continental Bfast ,Parking & Wi-fi”
Reviews.Author: Angel014
Reviews.Content: My husband and I drove for 4 hours from Yosemite Park and booked the Travelodge Presidio for our 2-nights stay in San Francisco. The room was compact but very clean and comfortable. My husband enjoyed the free Wi-Fi , HBO and Parking. We liked the location as it was away from the main street and was quiet and safe. We walked down a few blocks for dinner. The staff were friendly and helpful. The next day, we had a continental breakfast. It was nice and relaxing. The location is a bit far from the main attractions but we didn't mind as we hired a car. It was truly a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel to stay at!”
Reviews.Author: SCgirl123
Reviews.Content: Tyler the manager is always willing to work with you on room availability. I couldn't recommend a better hotel in the area. Great price, perfect location, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Travelodge Presidio is well worth the price”
Reviews.Author: Szabby
Reviews.Content: We were two adults and a child for two nights in San Francisco. The Travelodge was just what we were looking for. Privacy, cleanliness, sufficient space, and great location. We found them all. Across the street from the Presidio, an easy walk to the Exploratorium, Palace des Arts, Chestnut Street, marina, Crissy Field. And for $150 in the middle of SF, it's a great price. Okay, it's a little tired around the edges, and there were a few holes in the bathroom walls where fixtures were changed, but that didn't bother us. It's easy to get everywhere, and parking at the Travelodge is free. They even let our visitors park in their lot.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, close to everything”
Reviews.Author: hbjill
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend in early August. Flew in to SF airport, no good transportation late at night to motel, but we called the desk and were given instructions on how to get there via Bart and a taxi. Next mornig desk clerk was very helpful in getting us bus schedules and directions to whee we needed to go. Bus stop very close to motel. Nice room, older but well maintained. Quiet, even though it is fairly close to main street. Not enough parking, so good reason to not have own transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Want A Super Place To Stay With Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: Aliky53
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Travelodge at the Presidio in San Francisco. The staff at the Hotel were extremely friendly always going the extra mile to make us feel at home. The rooms were very nice and always cleaned when we got back to our room. Tyler and Raymond "Ray" were exceptional. You were always greeted with a smile and a Good Morning, Afternoon, and Evening. They made sure that whatever we needed was a priority. The Continental Breakfast was ok. Fruit and juice would have been nice but I see that room would be an issue. Parking was tight but was manageable. In the evenings it was quiet. Within walking distance to the "Palace of Fine Arts", restaurants, and Presidio. All in all our stay was outstanding!

Reviews.Title: “awesome staff, great location, free parking!”
Reviews.Author: aussie020
Reviews.Content: travelled from Australia and after looking at many other motels, we decided on the Presidio Travelodge for the loctation and couldnt be happier. its in a nicer part of town, near park, and walking distance to Chesnut Street with loads of shops and cafes. the staff were great, especially Raymond, he was a huge help to us with friendly advice about where to go and what to do around the city. its quiet, safe and clean. we would stay again. thanks Ray!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great service and staff, and a clean, upscale room.”
Reviews.Author: laurenkauai
Reviews.Content: The manager Tyler was helpful and friendly. My boyfriend and I really appreciated the Judy's breakfast coupon and the great recommendation! The food was awesome! I loved the view from our room and the bathroom remodel job was fantastic. The staff were all personable, yet professional and the location within the Presidio was perfect. Overall, our stay was made comfortable, affordable, and fun all because of this hotel. Again, Tyler was a great manager, very knowledgeable and congenial. Thank you for providing such a spectacular home-away-from-home for us!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay fantastic staff comfy beds great internet!”
Reviews.Author: localadelaide
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights on our arrival in US and the last two nights before departure, rooms are adequate for the price, the beds are the BEST! Quiet location but still handy free parking and free internet, breakfast included for a very reasonable price. But the most memorable feature are the friendly and helpful staff - Ray and Shelley couldnt do enough for us - nothing was too much trouble - where to go how to get there shopping hours etc - anything you want to know just ask! Leaves you with a nice memory of San Francisco - would definately recommend for the budget traveller and would stay here again! Thanks Ray and Shelley - your help was very much appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place serves its purpose.”
Reviews.Author: bling416
Reviews.Content: The Travelodge was great. We just needed a room for the night during our memorial weekend. Very quiet and roomy. The staff was super super friendly and helpful in answering all of our questions on places to go, eat and check out. Very conveniently located we did not have to drive far for anything!

Reviews.Title: “What a great deal, for a really nice place!”
Reviews.Author: Heatherbrownstone
Reviews.Content: What a great location, for starters....just 1/2 block from the entrance to Presidio Park. It's very quiet, being a block off of the busy Lombard thoroughfare. Raymond, one of the clerks, just couldn't have been nicer and helpful, as was everyone we came in contact with. The room is smallish, but we knew that going in. The beds are very comfortable and the maid service does a very good job. We stayed 5 nights and everything was always clean and fresh. I would highly recommend this motel for a short or extended stay....one big perk is the free parking lot. Very safe neighborhood, close to the Golden Gate Bridge and near charming Chestnut St. for great bars and restaurants. Walking distance to the Marina, too. Thanks for a great, affordable time!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: ce-uk
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Travelodge hotels in the UK so we were not expecting the Hilton. This isn't a new hotel so the furniture is a bit worn, however it was clean, there was hot water and it was quiet. It is near the very end of Lombard street so the busy traffic has turned off at this point. The breakfast was simple - cereal, coffee and pastry - by edible and adequate. The beds were excellent in our room, very comfortable. This was good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at this hotel was excellent!”
Reviews.Author: oceanlover15
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here over Easter- Thurs. - Monday and we wished we could of stayed longer! The staff was excellent! On Thurs. we went to a ball game at AT&T park and had a 3 day muni pass and we weren't sure how to use the bus system but the man at the front desk printed out a sheet of what bus we had to take and where to go. We wanted to go to a beach and the front desk recommended a beach that you could find whole sand dollars and we did! We were a little scared of the parking but we pulled in at 2pm and found a spot and many others empty. We took our car out, one day and came back and there was still a spot. We will definatly be back on our next trip to San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Location!!”
Reviews.Author: fuman2000
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at this hotel. The customer service is excellent! The desk people were very knowledgeable about how to take the bus, things to do, and great places to eat. The location was great! We drove our car but didn't want to deal with driving and parking around town. The bus that went to Fisherman's Wharf was only a few blocks away . The only downside to this hotel is that the rooms are very small and the parking lot is first come first serve but it's free. It was hard for a family of four to move around the room. Our room was very clean. The breakfast was very simple-coffee, juice, oatmeal, pastries, and cereal. I would definitely stay here again. P.S. The Alcatraz tour is a must!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience - Rude staff!”
Reviews.Author: annabell7
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay through priceline. Even though I had a printed receipt, which showed our reservation had been paid for in full - manager refused to acknowledge our reservation saying it must have been canceled. She also refused to call priceline to confirm our reservation. We called them ourselves and were told there must have been some kind of computer mix-up. Travelodge had a room available but refused to give it to us at the rate we contracted through priceline. We were told we could have the room at more than double the cost. We ended up going somewhere else and paying much less. I can not overemphasis how rude this manger was. She was completely unaccommodating and unsympathetic to our situation. Do yourself a favor and do not stay here. Thankfully, Priceline refunded our money.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it!”
Reviews.Author: woodworker_8
Reviews.Content: Four of us (2 couples) were on a one month trip in the southwest U.S. We prebooked all our hotels and B&Bs and this was our choice in San Francisco because of the price and the location. We did not expect the Hilton but we sure didn't expect this. We booked two rooms for three nights and the comments apply to both. The room was old, well worn carpet and furniture that appeared filthy in the poor lighting. The bathroom was moldy in the shower, around the ceiling and on the floor. There was no toilet paper holder in the bathroom and when we complained they said it would be done the next day (wrong). I went to the office which was under renovation to borrow a screwdriver to do my own repair in the room and was directed to the maintenance man in the breakfast room. He was sitting at a table with his feet on the table drinking a beer but did manage to find a screwdriver. Needless to say we didn't eat the complimentary breakfast in that room. The bed was clean and comfortable, but that is the extent of the good comments. Parking was another problem and we ended up parking off the premises around the corner at a restaurant as the lot was continually full. We found another hotel and booked out early as we just couldn't manage to stay any longer.

Reviews.Title: “Location is no excuse!”
Reviews.Author: coldmachineUK
Reviews.Content: So the location is good but thats as far as i would go. The linen was dirty, the fridge was filthy and falling apart and the room made my skin crawl. Cheap is no excuse for failing to provide basic hygienic conditions. Avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Michael_Gr
Reviews.Content: We, two adults and a nine years old child, stayed at the Travelodge at Presidio on the 13th of July for three nights. After a warm welcome to the reception staff we entered our room that was the once located to the street side, The noise of the traffic was audible in the room but it was in an acceptable scale. The motel is located in that part off Lombard St. directly near Presidio with only a little traffic compared with the more troubled part a few hundred feet away. Our room was clean, not small but also not very spacious. Usually every room has an own parking lot. But not in this motel. There are less parking lots than rooms in the inner courtyard. Breakfast in the very small lobby was more than poor. Only coffee, cereals, and some kind of sweet soft cookies. The only change to eat or drink something was to put the whole stuff on a tray and took it with you to your room. Our son had a small infection at one eye so we had to go to a doctor. The staff at the reception was very courteous and did everything to help us. Conclusion: Despite of some lack the motel is a good location for exploring SF. An further advantage is the short distance to the Golden Gate Bridge. We would stay at this motel again.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay there again”
Reviews.Author: mickchiu
Reviews.Content: Stay there with my family four nights. Small rooms, old building yet clean and almost everything runs pretty well. The front desk clerks were friendly and very helpful. They did everything they promised. Location is good for tight budget tourists. #45 bus terminal station is only one block away. Not far from the Crissy field and Palace of Fine Art. Hiking to the Golden Gate bridge is also not difficult for young children. My biggest problem during stay is internet access, most of the time it won't work and the manager on duty told me it's the internet service provider's problems, they can't solve it.

Reviews.Title: “great location for the budget traveler”
Reviews.Author: luvtogoanywhere
Reviews.Content: Dates 6/24-6/28 Spent four days in san fran and was able to do just about everything on foot from this location. (we are in our early 50's) It is literally at the entrance to the Presidio (which is beautiful). Within walking distance of the marina (view of golden gate) then just up a scenic walk to fishermans wharf. If you walk straight up lombardo (and I mean up) you can access the crookedest street. One night we took a cab from fishermans wharf (too much happy hour) and it was only 8.00! Our room was old, bed linens were comfortable but exceptionally clean. New AC/heating had just been installed. Bathroom fan was extremely noisy so we just used the heating light most of the time. Not enough vanity space so I utilized the coffee area for hair/make up. People at the desk were extremely helpful. Continental breakfast was packaged rolls, cereal, milk, juice and coffee. Low water pressure, lots of hot water. Area felt safe even at night. Got a great package deal via travelocity. Well what can I say-definitely not a ritz carlton but I am sure it saved us a lot in transportation. Parking was not an issue on the days we stayed as we did have a rental car-just never used it. Average budget motel-great location.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Lodging for San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: clan4irish
Reviews.Content: This Travelodge is located at the entrance to the Presidio, which used to be an Army Post and is now part of the US Park Service. It is very near to the Golden Gate Bridge and is convenient to the attractions in and around the Presidio and the 'Marina' area of San Francisco. The hotel itself looks to be a renovated motel, but it's located in an area off the busy portion of Lombard St. so it was fairly quiet. I spent 3 nights there and slept well each night. I would recommend the rooms toward the back of the complex. The room itself was nothing exceptional but everything was comfortable, clean and functional. The beds were very comfortable with attractive bedding, a microwave and refrigerator were provided and the room (#301) was a corner unit with windows on 3 sides. The bathroom was very small, similar to european B & B bathrooms with no tub just a shower, but everything was clean and in working order. The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful, the housekeeping staff did a good job. A very skimpy continental breakfast is offered at the front desk; juice, coffee and some breakfast rolls which you have to eat in your room or elsewhere. There is no breakfast room but there are many great places to have breakfast. The location offers many unique eateries nearby, and Chestnut St. has a wide selection of cafes, coffee shops, bakeries, restaurants with every kind of dining and grocery stores selling exceptional produce. There are many boutiques and shopping establishments as well. The area had only 2 franchise restaurants that I saw, an IHOP and a Johnny Rockets, everything else is a one of a kind. Parking is available but limited onsite and an overflow lot is around the corner. Street parking and public parking is expensive if you're not from a big city with similar rates. I paid about $100 a night for the room a double/double but found a $74 rate from the Roomsaver magazine. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Small room but great location”
Reviews.Author: Merlion42
Reviews.Content: We stayed there just for a day. Got the room for USD119/night (for 4 persons). The room is really too small for a quad room (see photo attached), the bathroom is clean, though it's very cramped. The breakfast is actually served at a small corner beside the frontdesk, which i find it funny.. The good thing is its excellent location. (i) very quiet- Other hotels along Chesnut Street are definitely too noisy to get a good sleep (due to heavy traffic). (ii) Convenient- within walking distance to The Palace of Fine Arts, and Chesnut St. If u are planning for a short stay and looking for a not-so-expensive room, I'd say, 'It's a good choice'. But do note one thing: When u check out, Remember to them the frontdesk IF U DID NOT USE THE SAFE. I got charged 'safety warranty tax' because I forgot to tell them!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: emeraldhse
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely fabulous. The room was spotless, the king size bed was comfortable and the location was magnificent! It was in a very safe neighborhood and within walking distance of great restaurants and shopping, plus the bus stopped right down the street. Gary was a great help in securing our shuttle to the airport and helping us with places to eat. The hotel was very quiet as it was at the end of Lombard street. Great place to stay and the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Great Time!”
Reviews.Author: CA-FL-TX-FL
Reviews.Content: Typical cramped motel room and overpriced ($109). But it was in reasonably good condition, the beds were comfortable, it was quiet at night (being two blocks from Highway 101), we had a fridge and microwave, and there was plenty of hot water. And the best part--the location! Chestnut, the "main street" of the Marina District, was just around the corner with plenty of cafes and shops and a real hometown atmosphere. Also, the Palace of the Fine Arts, and the waterfront were nearby, and you can take a public bus to Chinatown and Downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location - Great Front Desk Staff”
Reviews.Author: CConsuela
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the perfect spot away from all the bustle of a big city. The bus stop is right around the corner by the historic Gates of the Presidio. The bus takes you straight into China Town, shopping at Union Square. Beautiful homes on the famous Pacific Heights is one block away with enough steps offering aerobic exercise for those so incline like myself. On the other side, the Palace of Fine Arts is 1.5 blocks away beckoning in all its serenity. Chrissy Fields is across the road from the Palace which is exercisers haven. You can a beautiful early mornign view of the Golden Gate bridge from here... San Francisco is utterly beautiful! Wish to revisit next year.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible, noisy, dirty”
Reviews.Author: MRSHBUNNY
Reviews.Content: We stayed over 1 night on our way to the North Coast of California. We choose this hotel because of the reviews, the price and location to the 101. We were sadly disappointed. The hotel is undergoing renovations, which they did not tell us. There was trash everywhere and not just construction trash (carpet, etc..) there were dirty towels and sheets, lying in the passage way that looked as though they had been there for a while, there were fast food containers everywhere, just thrown on the ground and it looked like the trash had not been emptied in many weeks. There were cigarette butts overflowing the containers and stunk to high heaven (right outside our window by the way) and trashcans from the rooms, lying around the outside. They could have done so much better at making the place look at least presentable during the construction phase, but they truly didn't seem to care that smelly trash was everywhere. It is also a very noisy hotel and the sound carries down through the floors. We were kept awake half the night by other guests coming and going, slaming doors and yelling all night and by their TV at 4:00am. The showers had some mold in the corners and the bathroom floors looked scary. I kept my slippers on the entire time and would not walk on the bare floors. I have a thing about flimsy thin blankets and theirs were aweful. We had to bring in our down comfortable from the car to stay warm. Overall, if this hotel was a little more soundproof, and cleaner, it might not be bad for the price, but I will NEVER stay here again and cannot recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, Quiet + Clean Budget Hotel on the Presidio”
Reviews.Author: orangetime
Reviews.Content: We booked a single bed room here as a walk-in with a Traveler Coupon for $77 for 1 night, and the place was fine. Very clean and quiet, and about a block or two from the park. Swank French Bistro on corner along with a deli, and a pub just around same corner. Our L-shaped room was smallish, but very comfortable for a 1 bedroom. There were 2 windows facing the beautiful lush backyard, and the breeze coming thru them was great. I do remember seeing others' bathroom windows facing the balconies, as the previous reviewer had - so ask for one with windows to the back. Bonus was the fridge and microwave. Though there were a few other similar hotels lining these blocks (we didn't check on prices there), the neighborhood felt fairly residential, and thru the back windows you see some great architecture of the houses people live in around here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel for Budget Travelers”
Reviews.Author: CheapButSmart
Reviews.Content: I'm giving this hotel a "neutral" rating but as a budget traveler my expectations were actually exceeded by my experience there. I was looking for a cheap place that wasn't in the noisy downtown area and that didn't have postage-stamp sized rooms - and I got it! If you're frugal and don't mind not having an elevator, a lobby, or fancy furniture I think you'll be very happy with this hotel. The downside: our room could have used better ventilation. There was no way to open the windows and get the air moving without sacrificing our privacy. The bathroom window desperately needed a curtain as it actually faced into the hallway/balcony. Since the bathroom had no fan(!) opening the window was the only way to keep the steam down while showering so I had to hang a t-shirt in front of the window. Kinda silly. The result was that the room was a bit muggy. Also, as I mentioned, there is no elevator in this kind of hotel so don't stay here if you have trouble carrying your luggage up a flight of stairs. This hotel also does not offer much of a view and as you might imagine -- the furniture, carpeting, etc is not exactly brand new. Also also, HBO is supposed to be included but we didn't seem to have it (But, so what? We didn’t go to San Francisco to watch TV.) The upside: the price was shockingly low. This made it possible for me and my co-traveler to spend our money on more important things (like eating out and shopping). I booked the flight and hotel together through Orbitz rather than through the hotel itself so I would recommend doing that to get the best deal. Our room had 2 queen beds, a microwave, a refrigerator, dresser, vanity, and table -- and plenty of room for 2 people to move around. The location is EXCELLENT. A quiet part of Lombard right next to the Presidio. Very close to 2 bus lines as well as a nice French restaurant and a convenience store.

HotelInfo.Name: San Francisco at The Presidio Travelodge
HotelInfo.Address: 2755 Lombard Street, San Francisco, CA 94123
